Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: occy2
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Embassy Suites pre-cruise in Fort Lauderdale last year, we decided to book at the ES in Miami for one night pre-cruise. We found the staff friendly and helpful but the actual condition of the hotel left alot to be desired. It definitely wasn't as well kept as the one in F.L. We ended up taking a taxi from the airport after waiting for the shuttle for nearly 45 minutes. Check in was fine and we enjoyed a nice meal at Grill 305 and when we went up to the room all I wanted to do was take a bath and crash. I walked into the bathroom and as I went to draw my bath, to my horror the bath was full of hair. Upon further inspection it became quite apparent the bathroom hadn't been cleaned at all, although the towels were clean. I phoned down to reception and they were very apologetic and someone was knocking on our door within 15 minutes to do a thorough cleaning of the washroom. This has never happened to us before at any hotel and it was a bit un-nerving but being so tired it didn't prevent me having a good night sleep !!! The buffet style breakfast was good and our transfere to the ship went without a hitch. The trip to the dock was $10/pp which I figured was quite reasonable, although the small mini van was very crowded and extremely difficult for some of the older passengers to get into.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice for pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: BrWo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time pre MArch Break cruise. Was very busy and shuttles took forever--not the best first impression. Check in was good and room is waht you would expect . Lighter furniture would have been nice but probably couldn't take the wear and tear. Pool was very nice, as was fitness area. Had a great meal at the restaurant and they do a very good job of the Manager's reception (huge drink choice) and breakfast. Room service very slow to answer the phone and to deliver the food. My in-laws used teh parking facility and were highly impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay at Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: okgladmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night after arriving in Miami late on Friday night. A shuttle van picked us up within about 10 min. after we arrived at the curb. Check in was simple, even though at 11:00 pm, it was very crowded. The spacious room was typical Embassy Suites. We ate a quick breakfast before leaving for the cruise ship terminal. The dining room staff was pleasant and the food was good. We had made to order omelets and plenty of coffee and juice. We asked for a taxi instead of taking the shuttle to the port and one was hailed for us within minutes. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tammy400099
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. I loved the atrium in the center of the hotel. The rooms were spacious and very clean. They serve made to order hot breakfast until 10 in the morning. I will definitely stay here on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice option near airport”
Reviews.Author: Daneto60
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, and fully enjoyed the ample room, the nice breakfast and the manager open bar in the evening. The room I was given, while certainly ample, has a bit of a humid smell, that went away after a couple of hours with the a/c on. Transport to and from the airport was efficient and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Amenities and distance to airport is ideal”
Reviews.Author: OH_Becky_OH
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property 3 times during the last 12 months and have found it to be clean, comfortable and well priced for the amenities. The airport shuttle is easy to use and saves you money especially if only staying at the hotel before and after a cruise. The pool area is pretty nice and you get a great view of the planes flying overhead. The cocktails at the manager's reception and breakfast variety were also welcomed amenities. Each time the front desk staff has been helpful and friendly. I've stayed at a few other airport properties in the area and this is by far the best value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, awful location”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly nice hotel with pretty amenities but the location is not very good. It's a telling sign when the hotel is surrounded by high fence with barbed-wire on top. Staff was great, friendly and accommodating! Treadmills in fitness have issues. Wobbly and on-board TV's did not work. One treadmill I used would incline but then subsequently would not come back down while I was running. Would think hotel would be more concerned about condition and possible liability. VERY COLD in this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Superior as usual”
Reviews.Author: Bankofdad2
Reviews.Content: It sometimes may seem to get old, but Embassy Suites has never ever failed to live up to and most generally beyond expectations. The afternoon reception was great. The front desk always more than helpful. We ate dinner in our room after a long day of traveling and it was brought to us sooner than expected, was cooked to perfection and what was supposed to be hot was hot and what was supposed to be cold was cold. What more could one ask for? The suite was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeD43x
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night after we took a cruise. What a great Hotel. Beautiful Lobby.Large Clean Rooms. We arrived at 515 pm and after checking in was welcomed to complementary bar drinks,popcorn,and snacks until 7:30 pm very cool.These restaurant was very good with a wide variety of dishes to choose from. The next mourning we had a breakfast buffet that was the best I've had at a hotel.Made to order omelets, biscuits and gravy, cereal yogurt,bagels and lots more.They also had a free shuttle service to the airport and to the cruise ports. Very please with our stay. My 2 complaints are $16.00 per night to park ,and really close to the airport so there is some airplane noise,but that was to be expected.We payed $144.00 for 2 people one night

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel if you need to stay at airport.”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: Arrived late in the evening and check in was fast. Bellhops very friendly. Rooms were great. Fold out couch for second bed could use a air matress pad or something. No plane noise til 7am. Great made to order breakfast. Guy cooking omelets knows what he is doing and has a great smile and attitude. WILL stay here again when flying around Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: BlueWaterBabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the night before a cruise. It was a fabulous value. the free airport shuttle service arrived quickly with a very nice driver despite some rude behavior from a few of the other riders. The room was huge, very nice and clean. The food was terrific, including the free buffet breakfast. The staff was very helpful. The only reason I did not rate it the full five is because their restaurant was short staffed (one waiter only) when we ate and I had to hunt down extra water at one point because the waiter had to chase down a large group that had skipped out on their check. Also, the cruise shuttle's last run was at noon even though our cruise wouldn't allow people to check in until 1. Overall, the experience was great enough for me to reserve there again this year though.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay, ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Tim60745
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Embassy MIA International Airport on our return trip home from Fla. Especially an excellent dinner at the hotel grill that evening and great comp. custom breakfast the next morning before checking out with super help from our bellman, Elvis...he's one of the best we've encountered in our travels...this guy enjoys his job, and it shows!!! Thanks Elvis!! Jeanette and Tim McInerney Boston, MA

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is fine”
Reviews.Author: travelBerlin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 2 nights at this hotel previous a cruise. The hotel looks good and the rooms are nice and large. Positive was that I was able to check inn before regular check inn time. This was good for me because I had a night flight behind me. They could not give me my booked room (king bed) because they said my room was not ready yet. Instead I have received a double bed room. It was Ok but unfortunately not clean. The room still displayed the garbage from a previous guest and the bed could show that somene has been lying on it before I came. It took me many calls to get this fixed. The guy at the reception took notice of this but nothing happend. Only later in the evening Housekeeping fixed the problem cleaning the room. I guess I could have as well waited for my booked king bed room. Breakfast was good and also the included drinks in the evening were Ok. The hotel had a convenient free shuttle bus from and to the airport. It also had a shuttle bus for US 10 roundtrip to dolphin mall. Additionally I could book a shuttle bus to the port of Miami for US 10 dollars. I have found all these convenient. I would suggest to provide a free wireless internet access, because this is nowadays very much standard in Miami. Even the bus 150 from Airport to South beach had this free wifi service.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lee S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after flight and prior to cruise departure. Highlights from the stay were the manager's cocktail reception (great bartenders) and cooked-to order breakfast. Rooms were spacious and clean. Particularly liked that there was separate sink/grooming area in both bathroom and bedroom as well as a wet bar in the living room. Despite the close location to the airport, there were no issues with sound. The hotel location is somewhat industrial with little dining/shopping options in walking distance other than Bennigan's. All in all, it served my purpose well.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, Excellent break-fast!”
Reviews.Author: carlos_canada
Reviews.Content: Very good location, but read carefully your map instructions if you are driving! The hotel is at an awkward location near a large intersection and under an over-pass. Take the shuttle if from the airport. Excellent break-fast. Very good swimming pool, fitness center and business center. Some of the rooms are dated but OK. Do not go high if you have vertigo and fright of low railings!!! One of the best hotels near the Miami airport that is rated a a 3.5 * (Just in case you want to book with hotwire or priceline)

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Ericboo
Reviews.Content: Upgraded room, can't hear much of the planes in rooms. Loved the free breakfast and mixed drinks. Plenty of shuttle services to South Beach, MIA and Miami Port.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay, food in the restaurant not great though.”
Reviews.Author: BUSTYBREEZER
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights just after New Year. Check in was efficient and quick and we were pleased with the room which was large and well equiped. The Managers cocktail evening each day was a pleasant edition and breakfast which was included was adequate. During both these times the hotel can be very busy and it can be difficult to find somewhere to sit depending on how many groups are staying at the hotel. The hotel has a free shuttle to the hotel and you just need to flag it down outside the terminal there is no designated stop. The bus is approx every 30mins There were a couple of negatives, my partner ordered a fillet steak in the restaurant and it was definately not a fillet, it was tough with sinue going through it and I had the chicken which was dry and tasteless so I would not recommend the food. They did refund the cost of the fillet as it was inedible. The hotel is difficult to get to if you are unsure of the roads as there are one way systems and different slip roads you need to take also the pool was too shaded and the pool was freezing. There are few places to eat within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent shuttle driver”
Reviews.Author: greghopkins
Reviews.Content: Wanted to thank Jesus for making a special shuttle trip to get us to the car rental building. When we asked about the Key West area he gave us some great tips and even called his dad on his cell phone to get the name of a special restaurant. Thanks Jesus for the special attention detail!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: Trisha M
Reviews.Content: My husband myself and our six month old son went to Miami last minute for new years to spend it with my step daughter who lives in south beach. We arrived on Friday morning checked in then went to bayside to pick up our daughter. At first the lobby looks a bit cheesy but the rooms were very nice and spacious. Although the scenery from our balcony wasn't very nice it would turn out to be nicer then we thought seeing as how when we rang in the New Year we could count over 20 different fireworks displays around the city, the kids enjoyed that just as much as we did. There is a nice atrium in the middle of the hotel as well as a great restaurant a bit pricey but very tasty. On a side note about the restaurant the first night my daughter and I went down to grab a bite to go but decided to dine in at first the hostess was rude and off putting but the server more than made up for it, after the meal they gave a comment card which I filled out and told the truth about the hostess. After I got back to my room I started to tell my husband what had happened and the phone rang it was the manager from the restaurant wanting to apologize and said he takes those cards very serious I was shocked because I was in the industry for 10 years and I know that most of the time the cards get tossed in the trash so I was amazed at the quick response. This is a good sign that the staff takes their jobs seriously and aimed to please. The morning breakfast buffet was nuts but was by far the best breakfast we had had in a long time. The pool was very nice if it wasnâ€™t for the occasional airplane you would think you were at a pool in Vegas. The gym was very nice not too big but it isn't like it was super crowded. The equipment was new and nice better than some 24hour fitnessâ€™s I have been in. It also overlooks the pool so if you donâ€™t want to watch the built in TVâ€™s on the tread mill you have a lovely tropical scene out the window. The staff was so nice and helpful not to mention the 2 hour happy hour in the afternoon were all drinks were entirely free. In the room we had a living area with a couch that pulled out into a bed with a flat screen then in the bedroom a huge comfortable bed with another flat screen as well. All and all we will be returning there it was great for family or for a trip with friends. At first glance you don't think much but you should never judge a book by its cover.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay for this Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caneshockey31
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel this past week for a Slide Fest and Aviation Photography Show... This being the 4th year staying here for the same show, I always get a room facing the airport on the 7-9th floors which afford the best view... The hotel is located directly off of South River Drive and is a mere 3 minute drive to the Miami International Airport... The shuttle runs every hour and half hour....and the same for the pickup at the hotel... The breakfast as usual is wonderful (however it is the only hotel) that suggests a time that you should be there to avoid the lines, since this hotel is heavily cruise friendly so on the weekends the lines can be long so going to breakfast earlier like 6:30-8am is suggested... Service this time was okay, the internet was turned off midway through my first night and didn't come on until early the next morning, when I reported it to the front desk they didn't have any idea of the sort and they said they would check on it.. An hour later I recieved a call from the front desk and was told that their System Operator was being upgraded thus that was the reason why the internet was not working...I asked next time you might want to alert the customer of the sort, so if someone was trying to do work or business e-mails that they would know and be able to accommodate... The rate was higher then it ever has been for my last 4 stays...My first night I paid $170 plus tax...after including the $16 a night plus tax to park my car as well as the City tax and suite tax the total was around $216 for the one night...the second night I used my points.... Even though I booked this rate 7 months in advance I still paid such a higher rate...but I understand the economy has probably affected that.... The hotel also has an on-site rental car office in the lobby where if you need a car they can accommodate that... Next year I might look for other Hilton properties by the Airport just to see if I can get a lower rate...

Reviews.Title: “Good for airport stop over after long flight.”
Reviews.Author: PYT13
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit as we had thought it such good value when we stayed back in September. Free shuttle from the airport. Managers reception 5.30 til 7.30 serving free cocktails (gin, vodka, rum, whiskey) and nibbles ( popcorn, nachos). Free breakfast. Cold and hot ( you have to queue for fresh cooked eggs). Clean serviceable room with free bottled water. Also free Internet but that might be because we are Hilton Honors members. Good value at $169 we thought.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice comfortable Hotel very close to everything”
Reviews.Author: RKCCEFamily
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise when I arrived on business as I thought this would have been just a normal hotel but the rooms were so large that I thought I had been upgraded to a suite or better. After calling the front desk I found that my room, which had a separate bedroom from the front living room, was truly offered at the price I paid. Much better than I expected. For being right next to the airport I could not believe that I was never aware of flights coming and going. I could only hear the planes taking off (right over the hotel) when I went outside. That was very pleasant. The pros far outweigh the cons. Pros: Beautiful atrium, extremely courteous and helpful staff, free managers reception every night with a great selection of drinks and snacks, huge apartment-like rooms with VERY big bathrooms, multiple flat screen TV's in the room, very well equipped work out room, business room with printers, faxes, and phones open 24 hours. Cons: Pricey restaurant inside the Hotel (offset by the free shuttle that will take you to any restaurant or business within 3 miles of Hotel and return)

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: minyanaire314
Reviews.Content: Dont be fooled! When you complain about the noise, they will tell you it is an airport property. I've stayed at airport properties before, but this one is so noisy...there is either no insulation or all the seals on the windows are broken. We can hear every plane that goes by. The other room they showed us faced the highway and you could here every horn and truck. We did try to change rooms, but the front desk folks told us..."it is an airport property." The happy hour is just just chips and drinks....no veggies like at other E.S. The shuttle that is supposed to run every 15 minutes really runs every hour. The location is awful, there is no where to walk...again, they tell you it is an airport property. Spring for the cab and stay somewhere else. We are here now before our cruise....we wont come back at the end!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: kateoquinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the night before leaving on a cruise. When we booked for the hotel, we chose the stay one park seven option so we could leave our car. I liked leaving our car here because the lot is secured, We also took the shuttle from the hotel to the port ($10.00 per person). The hotel itself was nice enough, and it was festively decorated for Christmas (which I liked). The bed was also comfortable. They do need to work on their breakfast, I have stayed in other Embassy Suites that offered a much more pleasant dining experience.

Reviews.Title: “Holliday shopping 2011”
Reviews.Author: Donald147277
Reviews.Content: We flew in from the Caribbean on the 27th of December and checked out on the 30th. I got a good deal on the stay using my Hilton Honors points, and we got a 2 room suite right in front of the elevator on the 8th floor. It took some effort to get a crib but once we got it, it was all good. We truly enjoyed the bed and breakfast while we were there since we weren't there much. Word to the wise: be early for the breakfast since there may be a line later in the am. The fish in the pond were an attraction for my 2 year old also. Checkout was a breeze without surprises on the bill. If you need something close to the airport with free breakfast included, this is highly recommended. There was a free shuttle to the airport but we never used it since we had a rental car from Hertz.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, overcrowded breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Irina A
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was pretty much disappointing. The service was not what you expect from this level hotel - they constantly supplied 3 towels for 4 guests, on three nights stay we never got the bath supplies - something was always missing (like they put 2 conditioners and no shampoo, or shampoo and body lotion but no conditioner). By the way, they don't have this ecology-friendly policy of towel changing. The bathtub looked very old and scratched, I can't imagine taking a relaxing bath in there. The refrigerator worked so-so, the ice cream didn't survive the freezer. On the first morning we went down to breakfast in their rush hour - huge lines, totally inefficient employees. Yes, they have recommended hours chart inside the elevators - how to avoid crowds, so we used their tips later and it was much better.

Reviews.Title: “What I expected from an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: mike m
Reviews.Content: stayed here before our cruise. not bad, very loud in the pool area as the airport is literally right across the street. large rooms. arrived with about an hour to go before happy hour ended, and went for a drink with my wife but the line at the bar was literally a 15 minute wait....we didn't. large spacious room, nice workout room. Beds comfortable, quiet room. Breakfast was hinted at being a madhouse(signs in the elevator recommend when you should go to avoid congestion), first time i've ever seen something like that. However, it was accurate. Breakfast was busy and crazy, the food was good though and they kept the lines moving.

Reviews.Title: “Awful -- Unrealiable Shuttle & More”
Reviews.Author: PlateMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel like many post-flight and pre-cruise. Among the many problems: 1. Landed at 11pm and went up to wait for the shuttle ... which never came. Most hotel shuttles passed up twice and when I called after waiting 30 minutes I was told it was on its way. It finally arrived nearly 45 minutes later and as you can imagine, was now packed. By the third stop, it was standing room only. Then the driver decided to drive like a madman to the hotel, swerving and speeding. 2. By the time we reached the hotel, the front desk had one person working. Some kids needed a band-aid so he left for 5mins to find one. Some 15 mins later, another person comes out to help with check-in. 3. The air con does not work well. At 80 in Miami, the bedroom was hot, the living room mild. 4. The WiFi is not free and when I pay [$12.95] I expect it to be fast, it wasn't. It was so slow that it was unuseable at points. 5. The lobby had a wet spot that was clearly left out all night. I almost broke my head open on this. 6. The bathroom was not 100% clean. There was a dirty plastic bag left under the sink. 7. I contacted management to raise my concerns and never heard back. That's just awful customer service. All of this added up to a terrible experience. And this is not a one off, I have 39 reviews to my name here. I would never return to this place, there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Deesee63
Reviews.Content: Nothing special. Room was generously sized and clean. Beds were comfortable. Breakfast was good and the kids liked the pool. My brother's room was smoky, dirty and had no towels. A bit on the pricey side for value received.

Reviews.Title: “Nice big rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gus_976
Reviews.Content: We were five so the large rooms were great. At $190 + tax, it was a little on the high price for the location (planes fly over head all day).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl713
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel are absolutely gorgeous. It is a Embassy Suites, so that should be expected. All the rooms there are either one king or 2 queen with extra living area. The staff at the front desk were extremely friendly and personable. The valet area was sort of slow and when we needed our car they were not around and took time to come out. The hotel atrium was gorgeous. Nice gift shop and restaurant at the hotel, which we almost ate at, but decided to go to south beath. Unfortunately we didn't get to experience breakfast or the evening reception but I'm sure it was great. Obviously being next to the airport, expect to hear airplanes flying in and departing, so if you are light sleeper, get ears plugs like me!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chinchuwan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on December 15, 2011 prior to our cruise. We usually stay at Embassy Suites because of good service and this was no different. Caught the shuttle at the airport - only waited about 10 minutes for it. Arrived just in time for manager's reception and the bartenders were great - drinks were strong and also had some nachos. Breakfast the next day was also great. My only regret is that i wish we had looked at the pool area the night before. it's a great setting and drinks by the hot tub would have been nice!!!!! We took the shuttle to the Port of Miami. This was nice because it's a bus with a small trailer behind it to load your luggage in - you can roll it right in without having to bend or lift. Hector, our driver, gave us his card and he picked us up from the cruise (we called when we got thru customs) and took us to the aiport. we had a party of 9 and he bought a large van with the luggage trailer behind it. There is a restaurant in the hotel, but we ordered pizza so i don't know about that. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Terribly awful”
Reviews.Author: fred3116
Reviews.Content: It was a very very bad experience. Too bad!!! I've spent alomost an hour waiting for the shuttle, when I called, I've been told that the shuttle would arrive in the next 15 minutes, then after a 30min wait, it would leave the hotel in 5minutes. I decided to take a cab, when I finally get at this hotel, the shuttle was in the parking!!!!! The concierge have a different explanation of those of the desk. On the day of the check-out date, I called the desk, the i waited for 10minutes in the desj before seeing someone...

Reviews.Title: “Great after cruise relaxation”
Reviews.Author: mcjolley
Reviews.Content: Heres the good - nice big suites - flat screens - Comfortable bed - AWSOME breakfast and managers reception beats everbody - free paper - The got to live with it - A little noisy but its an airport hotel - a bit older but they are working onit - Had a great time cannot go wrong staying here

Reviews.Title: “GREAT pre-cruise place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: REBELJOHN
Reviews.Content: We booked the stay1 night, park 7 days package. There is a $15 charge for parking for in addition to the package charge. It was worth it. Car was safe while we went cruising for the week. Breakfast is AWESOME!! manger's reception in the evening is well attended, and lasts for two hours. The drinks are not weak, either. The fee for taking you to the cruise port is $10 per person through Sunshine tours. While they don't book the return trip from the cruise port to the hotel, the driver gave us his card and we called him for pickup upon our return to the hotel, same price. Would definately stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Ruta1234
Reviews.Content: Coming back from Cayman Island, we had to spend a night in Miami. Embassy Suites shuttle picked us up at the Airport. We had a lovely room, good manager's reception, good breakfast. People at the Business Center looking in their FAcebook's kept the computers busy, busy, but the front desk staff helped me to get my airline tickets printed. Everyone was very helpful. Little problem came with the shuttle to the Airport - one guy said that he will drive, we gave him a tip, he never came around,somebody else drove us to the Airport, but he had to stop to get some people and said to us, that we are close to Delta, but we were not - I had to ask the airport security where is Delta and how far -well it was quite a distance to walk with the luggage. Otherwise the hotel was very good.

Reviews.Title: “On the balance, just fine.”
Reviews.Author: GrantGustafson
Reviews.Content: Good value considering the room was very large and clean, nearly like an apartment â€“ for about $82 incl. tax on my Priceline bid. A little musty smelling and dark, but the appointments help make up for it. Two flat screen TVâ€™s and plenty of furniture. In the restaurant, the chicken Quesadilla was $16 and yet about equal to typical fast food. Hot breakfast was plentiful, â€œfreeâ€�, and somewhat low quality. The staff I met were all very nice. They need better instructions for exiting the parking gate/paying. I was confused and I saw many others having issues. Not much in the neighborhood, even if you have a car. But the airport is right next door. The design is pretty dated - 80's?. But they seem to run it well and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tennisfamily808
Reviews.Content: I have yet to really go wrong staying at embassy suites most have a separate sitting living area from the bedroom. I like that there is a mini fridge,microwave makes it very convenient for us. Room service is usually good but this particular embassy had changed there menu which was not as good as other embassy resorts I've stayed at but not terrible. Always enjoy the free breakfast this one was pretty good. Located near the airport and easy access to the freeway It was a little on the loud side and when I left the parking meter where you scanned to get out would not work for anyones card and we waited 30 mins before someone came and let us out ( we paid 15/ night to park kind of annoying all and all it was a pretty good stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Price in a Generally-Expensive Destination Town”
Reviews.Author: Timandfrank
Reviews.Content: Not the greatest neighborhood (pretty industrial area), but right next to the airport, so it's about 6 miles in one direction to Coconut Grove/Coral Gables, and about the same distance in the other direction to downtown Miami. The hotel is exactly what you would expect from Embassy Suites - good quality at a reasonable price. Better-equipped fitness facility than many others, though, which was a bonus. The manager's reception in the afternoon was pretty lame (popcorn and massively watered-down drinks), but it's free, so who can really complain? Great (free) breakfast buffet is included with the room, as well. Like all Embassy Suites, it would be particularly good for families, since each room includes the bedroom and a sitting room with another television and a pull-out sofa.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Zugulu
Reviews.Content: Excellent complimentary full breakfast was a welcome change from the usual continental breakfast offerings of other hotels. The suite was very comfortable and the location near to MIA is unbeatable. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Stop-Over near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Arkansastraveler69
Reviews.Content: We booked a Friendly Planet tour to the Galapagos Islands the end of October, and the flight to Ecuador left on a Monday morning. We have friends in Miami, so we wanted a convenient place close to the airport, and, a easy ride to South Beach as we were flying into Miami a few days early. We could not have been more pleased with the price, seervice, room, and full breakfast. We have never been disappointed with any of the Embassy Suites we have stayed in around the Country --- this one did not disappoint. The quality is consistantly good to excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Covenient location with breakfast thrown in”
Reviews.Author: alexsinanan
Reviews.Content: Whenever I need to overnight in Miami before catching a connecting flight out of MIA, this hotel is my first choice. The shuttle from the airport is convenient, the rooms are spacious and there is breakfast thrown in as an added bonus. A room with a view of the airport can be requested and the room service is also excellent - the mashed potatoes are some of the tastiest that I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, resort feel, very accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: Tigerchuffs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights while interviewing in Miami. I chose this hotel based on reviews, free airport shuttle 24 hrs a day, free breakfast, managers cocktail hour and resort style pool. Rooms were very spacious, I could have spent the whole time in my room and not felt cramped with the two rooms, mini fridge and microwave, full size bathroom and tub/shower, and two beds. The breakfast was free and included a variety of hot items, pastries and cereals and cooked to order eggs & omlettes. My interview was over early in the day and I spent the evening at the cocktail hour before meeting up with friends for dinner. The cocktail hour is actually 2 hours and has an extensive selection of mixed drinks, beers and wines to choose from. No weak "all inclusive" drinks here either, I was feeling good after just one long island! The staff was very helpful as I needed to print something off last minute for my interview and the business center was full, they did it for me at the front desk. Both shuttle drivers to and from the airport were cheery and each gave me a free bottle of cold water for the ride. The bell men were helpful in finding a cab for the morning of my interview and checked outside frequently to see if they had arrive yet, when it had been 10 min and still no cab, they called again! Very attentive! I spent my last day at the pool and was allowed a one hour extension to my checkout time. Very helpful for a late afternoon flight. The pool was nice, large and clean with a resort style feel. Lots of beach chairs and tables. The hot tub was under construction but it was warm outside so I didn't even need to use it. For an airport hotel, this is a great place to stay! Kids will love the pool and fish/birds in the hotel foyer. Will stay here again and will recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Totally overated And outdated”
Reviews.Author: wizard32953
Reviews.Content: Hard to find, traffic routes in area are terrible. Located in terrible neighborhood. Room was dirty, carpet dirty. Fridge did not work correctly, called the desk repeatedly. Got no repair the 3 days we were there. AC unit in celing leaked, so carpet was wet. Once again, no repair. Asked about getting another room, but was told (of course) all rooms are booked. The breakfast was okay. Dozens of children running around. Asked 1 of the bellman about all the kids, he told us the hotel rented rooms to the county govt for transitional housing. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: crossley2b
Reviews.Content: Our stay overnight at the Embassy was not exactly planned. However, we got a reservation in the most efficient way. With that being said, the location isn't pleasant. Restaurants, grocery, gas, etc. are not within walking distance. The outside noise is a problem as well. The actual room was moist, and a few bugs were flying around the room.

Reviews.Title: “STOLEN”
Reviews.Author: vtoria63
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 3 days in august, with my 4 boys on our first day they complaint of the tv inside the room not working..so i reported the issue at the front desk on our way out when we arrived back in the room the tv was fixed but my son's new GreenDay hat that he left on the bed dissappeared. it was customs made from lids we reported the incident with a manager and to a very incompetent security guard who had asked me and my son to make a written report just when we were leaving 2 days after making a verbal report and been to the office 3 times. i've called the hotel 3 wks after and said they are still looking into it..and up to now i have not heard anything from the hotel ..i will not recommend this hotel for security reason at all. i will not go back to this hotel for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough property, but experience was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Iridescentkittie
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews, I expected this hotel to be excellent! And parts of it were - but I was quite disappointed in other areas. First, the good: The room and bathroom were very clean. Lots of channels on the two flatscreen tvs. Fridge/microwave/wet bar and dining room table were much appreciated. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have EVER slept on. The noise level in the room was totally fine, even though A) it's an airport hotel, and B) I'm pretty sure the hotel was booked near capacity. The business center had 4 computers and we were able to find a free computer whenever we needed one. Printer worked just fine while we were there. The pool area looked very nice, though I didn't spend any time out there. The lobby area was quite comfortable - I know because we arrived quite early at the hotel (9:00 AM) and had to wait three hours until noon for a room to be ready for us. I can't fault the hotel for this - their stated check-in time is 3:00 PM! I just wanted to warn fellow travelers not to expect a room at that time of day (we were checking in on a Thursday morning). Finally, the breakfast was much more than I expected - they had nearly anything you could want to eat, whether you had time for a sit-down hot meal or just wanted to grab something to go. Pancakes, bacon, eggs, potatoes, pastries/donuts, fresh fruit, cereal, etc etc. This was by far the best "free breakfast" I've ever experienced at a hotel. Now, the not-so-good: Other reviews tout the shuttle service that will take you to nearby restaurants/bars. Heck, even the hotel information book in the room mentions this service. However, when we asked for a ride to lunch, we were denied. "Too busy", they said. After browsing the dismal food delivery options in the area, we ended up walking to a nearby Bennigan's - only a 5 minute walk from the hotel. However, this is the ONLY restaurant within walking distance -- so be warned. If the shuttle is "too busy", they won't take you anywhere. This may not seem like a big deal, but to two exhausted, starving travelers - it put a really negative spin on the rest of our stay. Note - later that night, around dinner time, the shuttle DID take us to a nearby shopping plaza - and picked us up, too. However, they again warned us that they may be "too busy" to pick us up and that we might have to take a cab. So - be warned! The shuttle service to nearby attractions is NOT a given. (However, the airport shuttle service was great! Every 30 minutes on the dot, very punctual.) Overall, this was a nice property and I would stay here again - provided that I knew I wouldn't be requiring a ride anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Parking fees for guests????????? - - OUTRAGEOUS !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tammy g
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here!!! When you check out, the hotel will still be charging your credit card over and over and over again!! Nothing more I hate than when I've already signed for a bill and weeks afterwards still being charged fees that no one at the hotel can explain. It was my first and last time staying here. Never again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “best property & superb experience”
Reviews.Author: ericarecords
Reviews.Content: during my brief stay in this hotel I was overwhelmed with the responsiveness & efficiency of the staff right from the reception till the room service the rooms are excellently done & i liked the ambience of this hotel

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie M
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel with amazing service! If a member of your party is having a birthday let them know and watch the special treatment begin. A birthday is not required though to have fun. The staff assist in making the hotel home. The managers happy hour (actually 2), made to order breakfast and shuttle service make this a great value. If one of the shuttles is a bit late; please be patient. Chances are that it is bringing guests to a restaurant or shopping mall. They will do the same for you. We would stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: SixAlpha
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during an overnight layover enroute to the islands and had a wonderful time! Check in/out were a breeze and the airport shuttle drivers offered free bottled water, which was a nice touch. Even though the place is only 5 minutes from the airport, shuttles only seem to run every half hour so be prepared to wait for the van. We booked using Hilton's "suite romance" package which included champagne and a basket of bath goodies which my wife really enjoyed. Our room could have used some updating, but everything worked and it was large, well-appointed and remarkably quiet given how busy the hotel was. In fact, my only complaint with the hotel was how crowded it was, especially during the manager's reception. But hey, what do you expect when you offer people free booze?? Overall, the hotel seemed very clean and well-managed. The morning breakfast spread is very good, and the fish pond and foliage in the breakfast make for a nice ambiance. Dinner at the hotel restaurant is also surprisingly good for a hotel restaurant as well. We didn't use the pool of gym, but they looked nice enough when we walked by. The hotel also has a decently large business center. The Embassy Suites was a good choice for a layover, and I'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre/Post cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: msmommy718
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on August 27, 2011 before a cruise out of the Port of Miami. There were 19 of us in the group and we could not have had a better time!!! We arrived at around 10:30AM, and our King room was ready!!! We went right up to the 8th floor to check out our beautiful suite! The room was gorgeous and modern. It has a nice, large bathroom, living room, and bedroom. There is a kitchenette with a fridge and microwave. Our 4 and 5 year olds enjoyed sleeping on the sofa bed and thought it was really comfy! We went straight out to the pool and had a nice swim. Yes, there are planes flying overhead, but the kids thought it was the coolest thing they have ever seen!! We decided to get some dinner and asked the front desk for some suggestions. They recommended the Hitching Post and they arranged for the restaurant to come and pick us up. This is a casual Mexican/Cuban restaurant and the food was GREAT and the prices were very reasonable. It was a very nice meal! We then met the rest of our group at the manager's cocktail reception. We enjoyed some drinks and snacks and socialized with everyone in the beautiful atrium area of the hotel! We then had a great night's sleep and enjoyed a delicious hot breakfast the next morning before getting the shuttle to the port. We loved it here!

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: criticaclara
Reviews.Content: Poor maintained rooms. A large group of drunken loud people were celebrating around the lobby until midnight. A visibly intoxicated woman was banging on the roomâ€™s door next to our room, crying, and yelling because she was not allowed to get in. It is clear that management does not care about these issues. There are not places to eat around the hotel we had no choice but to eat at the hotel's restaurant one night and it was not the exception...another drunken guy disrupting the peace. It was a very disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: Joan O
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites Miami Int'l Airport, Miami, Florida. I only realized that the hotel was located in the airport compound when I returning to the airport. It was so quiet and peaceful. And the room, that room was soooo comfortable. The courtyard had the setting of a tropical paradise; the chirping of birds, the flowing waterfalls, the beautiful fishes swimming carelessly in the river, the tropical plants... Being a nature lover I was amazed that such scenery existed in a hotel that gave nothing away upon entering. The service was excellent. We had a scrumptous dinner which was served promptly to my amazement although it was freshly prepared and there appeared to be a full house. Breakfast is served every morning as part of the fare which was very reasonable. Checkout was easy, no problem, courteous and helpful staff. Anytime I am going through Miami again I defintely will stay there, Nice, cool and comfortable place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Musty mildew smell; airport shuttle unreliable”
Reviews.Author: artlovinchik
Reviews.Content: I have always enjoyed stays at other Embassy Suites but this one was a disappointment. Upon arriving at the airport we called the hotel at 12:15 a.m. for the shuttle & were told they run on the hour and half hour and where to wait and flag them down. We waited until 12:35 a.m and were told it would be there at 12:45 & to "hang tight". Shuttles to other hotels continued to come and many passed by twice during our wait. At 10 minutes to 1 a.m it finally arrived with one passenger, no explanation and no apology. Then we arrived to musty smelling halls and rooms. I couldn't find any place to adjust the thermostat in the room. The breakfast however was top notch as usual. And the shuttle departed on the time that morning. When we checked out the next morning the clerk asked how our stay was and when I said "no very good" she replied she was sorry and that was it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good rate for 6 people, and great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: paradocsatl
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at an Embassy suites, and it was pretty good. The breakfast greeter was wonderful - very nice Polish lady who made sure everyone was being accomodated and was very apologetic for any delays getting through the omelet making line. The food was fresh, everything was clean, and there was a nice variety. Don't count on anything for the manager's reception though, which was the biggest downside - it should just be advertised as a "snack time" or something, since EVERY night was the same pretzels, popcorn, and little goldfish crackers and that was it. The popcorn ran out routinely as well. The hotel is a little dated, and the front elevator can be slow. The hotel is very accessible to downtown Miami pretty easily. Its a good 45 minutes from the Ft. Lauderdale airport, and there is no transportation there, so be aware of that. The pool is nice too - our teenage/college age kids really enjoyed that. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a heated room. I won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: Ken W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel post-cruise in December 2010. After reading other negative reviews, and feeling that Embassy Suites are usually very good hotels, I ended up booking this one anyway. I was mistaken to not heed the warnings of other reviewers. We arrived before check-in time, probably around 1pm. There were many other guests waiting in the lobby for available rooms, probably from flights or other post-cruisers. As stated, check-in time is 3pm, and you are lucky if you can check in before then. We had our infant with us, and were able to check in about a half hour early thanks to the lady at the guest relations/services desk. The front desk staff were just not interested in helping us or anyone else who wasn't already a guest. If we didn't have our baby, we would definitely be waiting longer. The room was OK, with standard amenities common to all Embassy Suites. We did ask for a crib, or Pack-N-Play for our baby, but it required 3 calls to the front desk before finally arriving after 7pm. The pool was OK, with lots of trees which limits the sun exposure, and as a result, regulates the temperature of the non-heated pool. As we stayed in December, the temperature was cool. (I would guess about 76-78 degrees.) The hot tub beside the pool felt about 100 degrees, and was much needed to warm up after a swim. There is a restaurant onsite, but we decided to walk over to Bennigan's for a less expensive meal. (around the block) The biggest problem was with the A/C and heating system not working properly. The system would not shut off, and continued to pump out cold air all night. The daytime temperature in Miami was well into the 70s, which was fine for the A/C. At night, the temperature dropped to the high 50s, and so did the room. At 11:30pm, we're not going to pack up and move with our infant to a different room. We ended up all sleeping in the same bed, with our baby between us just to keep her warm. At least she got a good night sleep... Breakfast was the regular bacon and eggs cooked to order deal, which was as expected. At checkout, we did complain about the room. We were not expecting a free night, but maybe an adjustment to the bill for a freezing room. All we were told was that we should have asked for a heated room! As a regular business traveller, I guess I'm naive to think that all US and Canadian Hilton hotels would have standard heating and cooling. Try asking for a non-heated room in Canada when it's minus 40 outside... If you would like to stay in a chain hotel in Miami, I would strongly suggest somewhere else than this Embassy Suites. I stayed at the Hampton-Miami Airport Blue Lagoon pre-cruise and also at the Best Western Premier Miami Airport for a pre-cruise in January 2011. Both hotels are a much better choice than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for cruise stop over”
Reviews.Author: IMV_11
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it had a shuttle service from Miami intl airport to the hotel. It also had a fantastic happy hour and a full breakfast. We also availed of the shuttle service to the cruise port for a very reasonable charge of $10 per person. The staff were very nice and the guest services recommended a great cuban restaurant. They provided us a shuttle service and piked us up after dinner. Everyone was very helpful and the hotel guest services rep helped my elderly dad get his breakfast, juice and coffee. She went out of her way to assist him. We will definitely stay there again when in Miami. It will be our choice of hotels when taking cruises. We were a group of 7 and reserved 2 suites. There was plenty of room and our stay was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again. Great to have an interior door in suite.”
Reviews.Author: ScubaJoolie
Reviews.Content: For the price, I love Embassy Suites. Travelling with two children, and having an interior door to close while we stay up watching tv is great (two big screen tvs). The breakfasts are amazing too! When you think of the costs for a suite and breakfast in most hotels, it's crazy not to stay there. However, to stay for business and have something sent there is a different story. It was very difficult to get someone to check the mail, and there often were several people waiting to speak to the person in charge of those things. But I would definitely stay there again. Clean, huge, beautiful with the standard indood atrium.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & service!”
Reviews.Author: Emarsh69
Reviews.Content: The hotel is the typical Embassy Suites design. It's very clean and the employees were friendly. The employees serving breakfast were especially friendly and helpful. I really liked the full service breakfast (which is included) and the happy hour. It's located near the end of the runway at Miami airport, so it can be slightly noisy. It wasn't to me, but I'm an airplane nut. Lots of restaurants and a grocery store within 15 minutes of the hotel. I had a room on the 9th floor which was great for me. It was away from all the noise and action in the atrium. The only negative thing I can say is you have to pay for parking and internet. Otherwise it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: tessy28
Reviews.Content: we stayed just one night here and the staff was excellent and friendly, the room on the 4 floor facing east was a bit noisy, because there is a train passing and the train blows its horn a lot. the breakfast buffet was great and included,only with the dinner we were not satisfied but the lady on the reception was very helpful in this matter and therefore again thanks we can recommend it because of the helpfulness

Reviews.Title: “We really liked this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ciera1love
Reviews.Content: Good stuff: We really liked this hotel and stayed for just one night after coming back from our cruise. The girl at the front desk was so helpful and she let us check in early, at 0830, instead of waiting until 3 pm. the pool area is very nice. The breakfast items were very good and we took some items to our room since we left before breakfast the next morning. The bed and linens were very comfortable and we slept well. Not so good stuff: the hotel is in a flight path....directly in the path. It's very loud. the restaurant is ridiculously expensive. We walked next door to the Bennigan's by the Red Roof Inn and ate there instead. the atrium area is very loud during the manager's reception. The noise floated up to our room. the atrium area has a very loud echo. The elevators were painfully slow, as was the internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at the Airport”
Reviews.Author: StogieTbg
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic. A little older but redone nicely. The rooms were a surprise as they were much larger than anticipated. The staff were gracious and went out of their way to make sure we were happy. They even have an evening get together with drinks and free breakfast in the morning. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place -- very crowded.”
Reviews.Author: adrian_ok
Reviews.Content: With four kids, I (like many bigger families) prefer Embassy Suites and have stayed in multiple throughout the country. This was by far our favorite one, although it was crowded with "cruise-type" people (very low brow). Most notable is the excellent pool and large hot tub that is ACTUALLY HOT. My kids loved it. The happy hour at night was obnoxiously crowded but the drinks were flowing like a frat party. Breakfast was chaotic but, again, got the job done. The room was clean and very comfortable. There was even a view of downtown Miami on the balcony (oh, and the door to the balcony actually works so you can stand outside). The location in Miami is great, too, right next to the airport and a short drive to Miami beach. For less than $100, I would say this placed can't be beat for the price and what you get for a night or so.

Reviews.Title: “excellent guest service. we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: fazied s
Reviews.Content: My family stayed 10 days at embassy suites. when we got to the airport we called for the complimentary shuttle. It arrived within 10 minutes. Check in was a breeze. The cost per night for the room was excellent considering that it was a suite with complimentary buffet breakfast and complimentary manager's reception on afternoons also free transfers to nearby restaurants. Room attendants were very friendly , the room was clean and bathrom always well stocked with supplies. If you want your every needs met, you must 'hook up' with guest ambassador Tamara S. Acuna. She treated us like family. My sons birthday was during our stay and she organized a birthday cake, snacks, drinks and even balloons....all complimentary..... and a great surprise after a day at the zoo. What was appreciated even more , is that she took the time to converse, share personal stories and give advice on things to do in miami.Staff generally were very friendly. There is a car rental agency at the hotel so renting a car was not a hassle. We would definately keep Embassy suites as our first choice when visiting miami next. Special Thank you toTamara for making us feel at home...........Ramgarib Family August 2011

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: markbenn
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel four months in advance through American Airlines Vacations for a one night layover between flights. We booked this hotel because of the their airport shuttle, size of the rooms and the included breakfast. We were traveling as a family of six with four teenage kids. The morning of our travel I called to comfirm our reservation for two rooms and to let the hotel know we would be arriving late. Our flight was to arrive in Miami at 12:26am. I was told by the representative that they only had one room reservation, even though I had a prepaid voucher in my hand inciating two rooms. The agent was very short and indicated there was nothing she could do and that they were sold out for that night. I called American Airlines Vacations and they later left a message while we were in flight indicating that the matter had been taken care of and that they would have the rooms for us. Upon arrival in Miami I called for a shuttle pickup and was told that the shuttle was at the airport on the hour and half hour. That was at 1:10am We waited nearly 40 minutes and no shuttle. I called again and was appologized to and told that the shuttle would be there at any time. Then I was then told that, by the way, the hotel was overbooked and that they would be walking us to another hotel. I went through our previous conversations that day and he indicated there was nothing that could be done. The hotel they walked us to did not offer a complementary breakfast which ended up costing us $106 for their buffet breakfast. The hotel they walked us to did not provide nearly as much room as and Embassy Suites room. The shuttle did not arrive for another 10 minutes. We paid for two rooms at the Embassy Suties, they did get us three rooms at the other hotel because there were only Kings rooms available. However, they complained about that and tried to only do two rooms, we waited 50 minutes, between 1:00am and 2:00am for a shuttle that is suppose to run every thirty minutes, and spent another $106 on breakfast. They did offer to send the shuttle to pick us up and bring us for breakfast but wasn't too sure about asking my family to get up even earlier to wait for another shuttle after such a short night already. We have stayed in Miami several time on similar lay overs and have never encountered issues like this. Beware of a prepaid reservation at this property, you have little recourse. (By the way this was not Priceline or Hotwire reservation) I will not be booking THIS Embassy Suites again!

Reviews.Title: “Busy busy hotel, little loyalty recognition, poor sleep”
Reviews.Author: wildthing271
Reviews.Content: Next stop on my trip after West Palm Beach was Miami Airport, where I was working. Best rate available within the Hilton family was at the Embassy Suites. The layout will be familiar to any regular guest of Embassy properties. A large atrium, with the breakfast and reception area surrounding large ponds filled with fish. Reception was busy and I expected this as this was an airport hotel. Unfortunately a room was not ready and it appeared that by Diamond status counted for little as I was placed at the bottom of the list for rooms behind non Hhonors members. I went away and did some work, and eventually on returning to the reception several hours later, managed to secure a room. Despite it being after check in time, the staff were reluctant to give me a room but being on my own meant I was able to secure one. The room was standard Embassy - a lounge area, a small kitchenette and a bed room, with en suite. The bathroom was roomy with new fluffy towels. The disappointment was the bed. I do not know what Embassy have done to their pillows, but they were incredibly uncomfortable. I thrashed around all night trying just about every combination of pillow known to man, but got very little quality sleep. When I doze off, I eventually woke later than expected and had to dash to the airport without being able to take advantage of breakfast. So not my best Embassy experience. My past few experiences at Embassy have been marred by poor quality sleep due to suspect pillows, and I may avoid in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: tkbocl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here one night before our anniversary cruise. Pickup from the airport was very quick. The hotel is right beside the airport, but it is still quiet and friendly. The rooms are just a little bit dated, but the. Derive was top notch: from checkin to the manager's reception, to breakfast, to checkout. The cruise transportation provided as part of our room package was also very convenient. I'm not sure this would be a good place for an extended stay, but for our purposes it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Cobweb Dusting”
Reviews.Author: sauerkraut
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a multi-family getogether before going on a cruise from the Port of Miami. The free shuttle from the aiport was a deciding factor, BUT they also had a shuttle into the area to take us to restaurants, which was a great deal. We did not use their shuttle to get to the port, but I believe it was a $10 charge per passenger. We ate in the hotel restaurant for lunch as we were all arriving at different times. The service was very nice but it took forever for the orders to be up. I don' t know if this was because we were eating at an off time or if this was normal for them. We were a party of 10 people and basically had simple sandwich orders so it seemed to be an excessive wait time for our order. As I was looking around the dining area I noticed huge cobwebs hanging from the palm trees, so their plant service really should address this. Also the area to the left of the rear elevators on the first floor of rooms needed a bit of care, it looked like the plaster had fallen off and had never been replaced nor repainted. It wasn't the most attractive view. The rooms were nice (room 418), because we were preparing for a wedding the dining table in the front of the suite was great for laying out our goodie bag stuff. It was also nice that the sofa had 2 hockers for additional seating. The sleeping area was nice, great blackout curtains and it wasn't noisy even though we were overlooking a street. The shower was nice, good pressure and the water was hot. I had no trouble sleeping there. Just a side note concerning noise in the room. The atrium seems to magnify noise, and if people are boisterous during the complementary cocktail hour it will echo up to the room. It isn't bad since the living room area is oriented off the atrium. I think our group might have been a bit rowdy and I did notice the noise level. Breakfast was included and very nice. An omlette station as well as eggs your way. The usual assortment of dry cereals, juices, fresh fruit and sweet rolls. The seating area is beautiful (the plants needed some dusting) and peaceful. There is a koi pond and waterfall that make for a lovely background. There are also some caged birds that are entertaining. The hotel reccommended "La Rosa" for dinner, a cuban restaurant not far. We used the complimentary shuttle to get there. It was a great place! The waiters were fun, lively and the food was delicious. By that time we were a group of 14 and it was late, but the restaurant accommodated us with no problems. There was a woman singing cuban songs and playing the piano, the crowd was involved and singing along or doing solos. We ordered things ranging from black bean soup to baked chicken and skirt steak. Everything was delicous and we all shared so we had a taste of everything. I rate this restaurant highly. All in all the Embassy Suites Miami Airport was a great place to stay for an overnight. We didn't have time to explore the area, so I can't comment on the location. The swimming pool was great, not chlorine processed, but rather with mineral salts. It was a bit strange at first. The weight room seemed to be okay, but I have no experience with its equipment.

Reviews.Title: “not bad but some things could be better”
Reviews.Author: 9of9
Reviews.Content: Airport shuttle was great - just waive them down at the airport, look for big green E for Embassy on side of van. Timely, friendly, give you bottled water. Called to hotel and made reservations for me to cruise port so receipt was ready when I got there. Location provides easy access to highways and airport, but definitely is not scenic. Hotel grounds are nice but rest of neighborhood is industrial. Jet noise at pool will drown out conversations. Rooms were nice, clean, beds comfortable but humid environment leaves a damp smell/feel. Breakfast was great -made to order omelets, eggs. Last hour is very busy and expect lines, so go early if you don't like to wait. $15 per day parking fee is a rip off and you have no choice but to pay it if you have a car as there is no where else to park. Room service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wishiwasinthevi
Reviews.Content: We ended up in Miami after missing a connecting flight. Hurricane Tomas rolled through St Thomas, so we were unable to leave St Thomas in time to make our connection to Chicago in Miami, leaving us in Miami overnight, on our dime of course. So we stayed at the Embassy Suites. It was a pleasant surpise, really. The hotel was nice, the beds were comfortable. It was myself, my husband, our 2 kids and my parents, we were able to get 2 King suites with sofa beds, so each kid had a sofa bed. I normally hate making my kids sleep on sofa beds as I think they're uncomfortable but these were great and my kids loved them. I would definitely stay at an Embassy Suites in the future. The breakfast was pretty good as well.

Reviews.Title: “"Great place to Wake up To"”
Reviews.Author: LaCuenta
Reviews.Content: The Front desk "Maria " was so thoughtful she hade our rm pre reg & a special B-day gift waiting for us in the room. Breakfast in the atrium staff friendly, great view & the pool was relaxing. Stood 1nt as we were spending the day in Miami Marina. Highly recommend this property. Thank U Maria for a special stay

Reviews.Title: “Second time here and we will be back again”
Reviews.Author: jmmstuff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before we cruised in Sept 2010 and July 2011 and we loved it. They had a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel and it was very timely (even when our plane was delayed until after 10pm). The breakfast that is included in great - omelet station, pancakes, eggs. bacon, sausage, etc., various breads and cereals, coffee, tea, juice, and my favorite - fountain soda (for us non-coffee caffeine lovers) is all included. They also have a managers reception at night which we have not attended due to the timing of our planes. The room was clean, the air conditioner worked great, the room had a mini-fridge and I think I remember seeing a microwave. There is a tv in the bedroom and "living room" area which is where the pull out couch is located. We took a cab from the hotel to the port and it was a fixed rate of $27 dollars. There is a shuttle to the port, but that leaves at 11ish but we wanted to leave earlier. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"I want to go back,"”
Reviews.Author: SUGE77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and a group of friends from college had the privilege to stay at this beautiful hotel. The rooms were fabulous especially the bed :) the service and food was great.. Embassy Suites will be my choice of hotels to stay at while visiting Miami....

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean place to stay the night before a cruise.”
Reviews.Author: Davehewett1
Reviews.Content: The common areas are well kept and the foliage in the atrium was beautiful and tropical. The pool was large and nice. The gym was just ok, but fresh towels were provided and we were able to get a good workout. The manager's reception is always a big hit, but the beer cups were tiny, but they did make the kids non-alcoholic tropical drinks. Breakfast was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: VickyES
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Miami International Airport June 18-20, 2011. We arrived 2 nights early for our cruise out of the Miami Port. The hotel was wonderful. Shuttle picked us up at the airport in a timely manner. Offered us cold bottles of water. Check in was quick and easy. Room was clean and spacious. Customer Service went above and beyond. Greg, who brought up our luggage even offered to get us ice for the room. We booked our Sunday excursions through the staff and they were amazing with setting those up and making phone calls. They even used the hotel shuttle to take us to a local restaurant for dinner on Sunday night and picked us up when we finished. The breakfast was amazing and the afternoon reception was great with complimentary cocktails and wine. We will definitely stay here again if we return to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with noisy pool”
Reviews.Author: Rhq1282
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice. Clean and crisp. Service is outstanding. But, if you're looking for a quiet day at the pool you'll need to go somewhere else. There are planes taking off about every 30 seconds and you can't talk or hear yourself think when they're going over. Pool is nice but noise level is horrific. If you're just looking for a nice place to stay and aren't planning on spending time at the pool it is great. It's a very busy hotel with all of the travelers getting on and off of the cruises.

Reviews.Title: “Easy, convenient, good value if you night a night near MIA”
Reviews.Author: Lollilove
Reviews.Content: We arrived late, asked for a quiet room. They put us near the top floor. Got a good night's sleep, enjoyed the enormous breakfast buffet, they let us stay in the room til 1:30 at no charge, free shuttle to MIA. The nicest touch was that the shuttle driver had a cooler full of cold water bottles which were offered both coming and going. Much appreciated touch! Staff clearly cared about making a good impression. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Lynsey1030
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night pre cruise and had a bad experience. When we first arrived we ate dinner at the hotel restaurant which was overpriced and below average food. We then went to the room and found out our TV wasn't working so we had to have maintenance come to the room to fix it. Then, around 12:30 at night we were awoken to water leaking from our ceiling. Maintenance came up and told us we were going to have to pack our stuff and move rooms. After all this the hotel only gave us a $50 credit. Horrible customer service. The only good thing about the stay was the complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Check your bed for bugs”
Reviews.Author: TerryTraveler
Reviews.Content: We were there two weeks on business, and one of my colleagues had bites in a circle across her throat. It was a couple days later when she discovered bed bugs on her sheers, mattress, and in the fold out portion of living room couch. She was only one out of 30 guests, but one is too many. Hotel reluctant to address, denied it was bed bugs although we received proof. This was reported to Hilton corporate. The service staff were nice and breakfast was nice to have every day.

Reviews.Title: “Stay the night before the cruise”
Reviews.Author: jjcopeland
Reviews.Content: My parents and my wife and I stayed here on the Saturday night before we took our cruise out of Miami. We stayed at the hotel because of the proximity to the airport and the port. There is a free shuttle that picks you up from the airport and there is a pay shuttle that will pick you up from the hotel and take you to the cruise port on Sunday. Both of these features made staying at this hotel well worth it. Just know.. everyone else does the same thing.. So breakfast on Sunday am is very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-cruise delight”
Reviews.Author: Altaemt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and 2 small b boys before heading on a cruise. The staff was excellent friendly and helpful. The room included a full buffet breakfast. The beds were comfortable, as we had 2 small kids would have been nice if we could have accessed the bathroom from the sitting room.

Reviews.Title: “Too many extra charges”
Reviews.Author: ajnuff
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Embassy Suites on a business trip after a less than satisfactory stay at a neighboring competitor brand hotel on a prior trip. If you have been to an Embassy Suites location before, then you know what to expect, as most locations are similar in design, room layout, amenities, services, etc. The pros: Good service and friendly smiles from the staff I encountered, interesting fantasy-styled architecture of the hotel from the exterior, all the Embassy Suites signature amenities, such as free breakfast and large suites, two flat-screen TVs, a decent choice of HD content in the channel line-up. Comfortable bed and spacious bathroom. The cons: The hotel charges $15 for self-parking and $20 for valet (per night), they also charge for internet access unless your room rate or Hilton status includes it. There is unavoidable noise periodically from the jets on takeoff from adjacent MIA, as well as train whistles at all hours from an adjacent railway. The room smelled quite musty when I first arrived, but having the A/C set to 65 helped, and I got accustomed to it. Some components of the hotel feel dated, and have been repainted an indeterminable number of times. Considering all, I would stay here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel despite it's age”
Reviews.Author: WEISSBIER
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights, last week. This is one of the original Embassy Suites from way back, late 70s early 80s. They have done a good job though and kept it in good shape. The open space atrium is filled with plants, trees and ponds filled with koi fish. This is also where the complimentary breakfast is served with an omelet station, yogurt, fresh fruit, breads etc., also in the evening there is a manager's reception with free drinks which is recommended. We had no rental car, but we noticed that parking is for a charge. Our room was on the 10th floor overlooking the airport. I am an old airliner, so for me it was great. For "regular" guests I highly recommend to get a room at any other location in the hotel, since the noise of departing planes is definitely something you want to avoid. The suites were standard ES, spacious with two flat screen TVs. A microwave, mini fridge and coffee machine were in the room. Bathroom was spacious with a bathtub. Within walking distance are some gas stations if one needs to "fill up" on drinks and snacks, a Bennigans is just around the corner, but we don not recommend it. The hotel has a nice pool and plenty of lounge chairs, a good size and well equipped fitness center and a business center, where the Internet can be accessed free of charge. In room Internet is for a charge. The staff was very friendly, we enjoyed our stay and would consider the hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: plbrnb
Reviews.Content: This is such a beautiful hotel, the atrium was my favorite place to be, so relaxing. We got in too late for the free drinks, but my sister and her husband said it was great, I know the free breakfast was outstanding. Every staff member was friendly and helpful, the best was Tamera, we called her the cruise director because she made sure everyone was having a good time, she was just great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: stella604
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay before going on a cruise. Free shuttle from airport .The hotel restaurant was wonderful and the free happy hour and morning breakfast was great.This hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Only 20 mins from South Beach by car.”
Reviews.Author: grahamnls
Reviews.Content: Easy reach to beach by car and good location for traveling about as it is in a good position for most major routes.

Reviews.Title: “nice room, lousy shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: DavidCamp
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites Miami On both April 2nd and 8th, and on both visits was very unhappy with the airport shuttle. The first night I began waiting for my shuttle at 12:00 midnight and was not picked up until 1:10 am after multiple calls to the hotel. Other guests were equally unhappy. They tried to say we must have missed our shuttle but we know that wasn't true with other guests at other pickup locations also waiting for over an hour. The next night we waited for 45 minutes at 11 pm, again after multiple calls to the office. Meanwhile other hotels would make the routine drive by for pick ups every 10-15 minutes. It was very frustrating. The following morning when being shuttled back to the airport the shuttle was 15 minutes late in arriving (despite their claim to leave every half hour on the hour and half hour) with the excuse of making several pick ups at the airport, but no one was on the shuttle when it arrived! And when I did arrive to the hotel late at night on the 8th, they then told me my room was not ready yet, and wanted to give me a room without a bed for my kids! Only after I argued that that was unacceptable did we get a room with two beds. All else was fine, with clean rooms and good breakfasts, but with the above problems I may never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: virgo60nine
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, transportation on time and friendly and the food was just perfect!!!...Not a great place to walk around, you will need transportation. Nearby restaurant had great food but the service was not the best.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lucidedios
Reviews.Content: Our only regret is that due to delayed airline arrival, we were not able to really enjoy this beautiful gracious hotel. We missed the reception, but we did get to enjoy a wonderful made to order breakfast served by friendly, helpful staff. The room was a bit noisy but you have to expect that so near to the airport and train tracks. We are not familiar with price ranges in this area so to us it seemed a little high, but perhaps it is to be expected near the airport. The shuttle from the airport and to the port was prompt and courteous. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location & Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: eagallant
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights after our cruise and LOVED it!! It was a $22.50 taxi ride from the Port of Miami (the shuttles there wanted $10/person & there were 7 of us, so a taxi is the way to go).
