The hotel is a $30 taxi ride each way to the International and Dolphin Mall. The suites are wonderfully laid out and will sleep 6 comfortably. Each room (we'd booked 2) had a TV in the living/dining area and one in the bedroom. There was a coffee maker, microwave and fridge. 5 minute walk away was the Pollo Tropical Restaurant with the best chicken ever!!! There was a Burger King and a couple local restaurants on the same street and a liquor store further down the street. They serve the absolutely best breakfast I've ever been served. The breakfast was even better than the cruise ship's - that says alot!!! Each afternoon from 5:30 to 7:30pm they have a munchies & beverage hour. One night they had chips & salsa and the other was pretzels & nuts and they always had theater style popcorn freshly popped. The kids could have soda and the adults could have anything from a fully stocked bar. There were laundry facilities on each alternate floor - $1.50 each for wash & dry and soap & fabric softener were available at the gift shop for $2 each. The hotel was spotless, very welcoming and inviting. You wanted to sit in the atrium and around the pool. About every 3-5 minutes, a plane flew over the hotel, as the hotel was within spitting distance. It was very loud if you were outside but you couldn't hear it when you were inside the hotel. AWESOME!! Our only disappointment was in that housekeeping didn't clean either of our rooms. I would absolutely stay here again and would absolutely recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Worn in places, but OK”
Reviews.Author: CitizenDave
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, if a little tatty here and there, and the in-room services were dated. It was like checking in to 1999. The wifi wasn't free and it was so slow as to be almost useless (as was the fixed-line in the business centre), the TV choices were limited and expensive (it was like $15 to watch a movie) and the lighting was poor for reading/working. But... the staff were friendly and efficient, the breakfast was great, it was 2 minutes from the airport and had a free shuttle, the rooms were comfortable. There was a pool that I didn't use and a fitness room that was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport. Good pre and post cruise location.”
Reviews.Author: TraveljunkieTexas
Reviews.Content: Convenient location near MIA. They offer a free shuttle to and from the airport. They also offer a cruise shuttle to the port. The hotel itself is just ok, and isn't really inexpensive in my opinion, but when compared to other Miami hotels is a pretty good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: mobileman4
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a short shuttle ride from the airport. The staff is very cordial and go out of their way to speak to you. The free breakfast is outstanding. Cooked to order eggs and other items. Also the regular restaurant is also good. The rooms are clean, and maintained Good value and choice if you need to be close the airport. Happy hour of course is a plus..

Reviews.Title: “NEEDS UPDATING!”
Reviews.Author: busybusymomof4
Reviews.Content: Not sure if they have any plans to update this dated hotel, but that said, it was a clean property, with newer bathrooms. Stayed there to catch a flight the next morning. Planes are very loud, but we expected that. Breakfast was good, employees nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Honors Diamond member will never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Sc0ttV
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m at Diamond level with Hilton Honors and spend over 40 nights a year at Hilton properties. This is the worst Hilton property that Iâ€™ve stayed at. We waited for over an hour at the airport for the shuttle. Finally we decided to take a cab. The front desk claimed that the shuttle runs continually but this wasnâ€™t the case. They didnâ€™t reimburse us for the cab. Our room looked nice but had two pillows for four people. The breakfast and service was very poor. The icing on the cake was their shuttle to the cruise port. The bellman and driver ask us to have our 22 month old sit on the floor of the shuttle so they could accommodate more adults. They refused to allow him to use his car seat. Yet another cab fare. Avoid this property.

Reviews.Title: “Clean well decorated spacious rooms and resort style facilities”
Reviews.Author: Ken3000
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and this is the first time I felt need to post a review. Only fair to balance comments from some of the travellers out there who did not have a good time at the hotel. We've stayed at the Hilton chain before and this hotel definetly lives up to the quality we'd expect. Clean next to new spacious rooms. Large King bed plus living area with flat-screen and pull out sofa bed. Bonus - I hate having to leave a hotel in the mornings to get breakfast so the free cooked-to-order breakfast they offer did the trick ! And then (at least when we were there) they threw in the 'Manager's special' every evening (free drinks !!!). Nice pool and hot tub too. All and all a real nice mini vacation. While the hotel is next to the Airport it seems the planes don't fly at night (that's how quiet it was).

Reviews.Title: “Typical Embassy with mediocre restaurant on-site”
Reviews.Author: Bobbarrenger
Reviews.Content: This Embassy Suites should meet all expectations associated with the very good chain. The suites are spacious with a comfortable living area, nice bed, and ample bathroom. This particular Embassy features a Southwest themed, spacious lobby that serves the famous Embassy free hot breakfast and free cocktails in the evening. This Embassy has a restaurant on-site called Barcelona. It features OMAHA STEAKS, as in the brand. I am from Omaha, so I know OMAHA STEAKS are a very low quality that we Omahans would never actually eat, so be aware. I opted for a Chipotle Chicken dish that was just a chicken breast with tons of cheese lopped on top. The tomato, mozzerella, and basil appetizer was very good. The hot breakfast was not as good as some other Embassy breakfasts, but was still very nice. The cocktails were not only free, but featured premium alcohol.

Reviews.Title: “Need of a remodel bad”
Reviews.Author: wick1979
Reviews.Content: Hotel is tired. A/C did not work in the room, so we slept with the screen door opened. Got the wonderful scent of weed at about 10 pm, followed by the smell of toast. Room was basic, sheets have been washed 1 to many times. Could not believe that a airport hotel charged for parking. I would not recommend stay here, the Hilton Airport is a much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great For A Short Stay!”
Reviews.Author: redxstate
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for two nights before a cruise. Yes the rooms are dated, dark and musty smelling, but there is more to this hotel than the rooms. â€¢ Very friendly and helpful staff. â€¢ Happy Hour with complimentary mixed drinks, beer, wine & snacks. â€¢ FULL complimentary breakfast with omlette station, fresh pancakes, & more! â€¢ Room service available (We recommend the BLT + Avocado) â€¢ Steakhouse restaurant in hotel. â€¢ Free airport shuttle â€¢ Free shuttle to the Port of Miami (If you are going on a cruise) â€¢ Cute gift shop Overall, this hotel offers a LOT of perks for an airport hotel. It the rooms were updated, I would give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Sick for over a week after my stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: DCbound56
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked by my company since it is close to the airport. Started checking other alternatives as soon as I arrived in the room. Since the room was pre-paid I had no option but to stay the night. Room had a musty smell and was very dated. As I was about to leave I noticed the underside of the toilet bowel had about 4 inches of black staining in the front. The following day I started having bronchial issues (tightness in chest, cough, etc.). Developed a fever 2-days later and lost a week of work and approximately $750 for doctors bills, medicine, and a chest x-ray. Pay a little extra and save money in the long run.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnbursby
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Miami Airport after a flight from England and en route to Lima, Peru. Miami Airport is by far the worst organized I have ever visited in the world. Allow up to an hour to clear immigration, another hour to pick up your luggage. Don't bother with free hotel shuttles : if you can find the right area the chances are the shuttle will simply drive past without stopping. Arriving at the haven of tranquility which is Embassy Suites, reception were polite and efficient. My suite, whilst not opulent, was quite adequate. Friendly bar area and my evening meal was good.

Reviews.Title: “No a Happy Camper in Miami”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl75555
Reviews.Content: Check in person and free breakfast very nice....end of compliments. Room had a pungent musty smell, tub dirty and didn't drain well, a/c would not cool off room properly (borderline sweat box). No free wifi and business center computer kept kicking me off after a couple of minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Eh... nothing special, but certainly not terrible”
Reviews.Author: malawimike
Reviews.Content: No need to re-iterate what others have said. The hotel needs some serious updating. Bathroom felt crampt. Unlike other ES hotels, the only access to the bathroom was through the bedroom. I had problems with the TV, but maintenance came up and fixed the problem. Also, I actually found the front desk staff all to be quite nice (others on here complained) and they really helped out this late-arriving weary traveler. One issue: yes, the planes are loud and yes, they fly all night. Bonus for me: somehow I did not have to pay for parking! No one ever asked for any money for my car! Tip: If you are flying in to Miami and using a GPS with a rental car, be sure to have recent updates to your maps. The roads around the airport are all torn up, some don't exist anymore, and getting around is a challenge because the GPS can't really help you out unless the maps are up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay at this hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: AliMaBe
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Miami in January to spend the weekend with my significant other. It seems nice from the outside, even lush in the atrium with all of the plants but that's about where the pleasantries stop. The rooms seem dirty, poor sound insulation between rooms and the hallway, and the customer service is rock bottom. I had a complication with my room and wanted to mention it to the front desk and try to get it resolved. I was never anything but nice to the front desk staff but everyone I spoke to could care less. Poor service, extremely rude front desk, all seeming to care nothing about their guests (which kind of defeats the purpose of paying $15 for parking and mid $200s a night). Much better Hilton hotels out there for the price, this one really does give Embassy Suites a bad name. If you are a rewards member, its not worth the trouble, pick another in the area and you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't compare to the many other Embassy Suites we have stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: LOVEROFPV
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Embassy Suites throughout the years and this was by far our least favorite!!! We checked into our room and the toilet overflowed and it ran into our bedroom, we called the front desk right away for assistance and they said they would send someone up,10 minutes later still no one came up so we called the front desk again and they assured us that someone would be coming, 10 more minutes and still no one came, I ran through the hotel looking for more towels to start to clean up the mess and then went to the front desk to let them know that still no one was helping us. At that time, I asked for a new room and they gave us the room next door. When we moved our stuff out of that room, we finally saw the maintenance guy in the room fixing the toilet. Once we got settled into our new room, we were looking out at the nice courtyard and breakfast area from the 2nd floor when all of a sudden we all let out a scream...as we saw something hanging from the beverage awning area (sorry, but I can't write what we saw as it isn't appropriate for trip advisor). I again had to call the front desk to let them know what we saw and they all came running this time! One of the employees said they have seen worse....now, I know it isn't the hotel's fault for the way their guest's act, but they need to do a better job of cleaning up after these "nasty" guests! The rooms are showing years of abuse, the breakfast was ok, the courtyard was pretty (most of it), and we were not impressed with the food at the restaurant. For the money we spent, I'm sure there are many better hotels in the area to stay at. From our one night experience, I can not recommend this hotel to anyone! It just doesn't compare to all the other Embassy Suites I have stayed at over the last 20 years!

Reviews.Title: “Gives other Embassy Suites a bad name.”
Reviews.Author: HubbieO
Reviews.Content: Didn't really believe the pother reviews. I thought, "it's an Embassy Suites. How bad can it be?" Well, I found out. It's old. it's dirty. It's poorly maintained. They charge $15 a day for parking. The breakfast buffet is very poor compared to other Embassy Suites hotels. Housekeeping is horrible. One day, my room wasn't made up until after I called the front desk after 4pm. Even then, it took a while. Called Hilton to complain. They explained this was a franchise. I told them they'd better pull the franchise because this hotel is giving Hilton and Embassy Suites a bad name.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel...but a little annoying at times.”
Reviews.Author: Atl_mediachik
Reviews.Content: A couple of my friends (10 total) from different locations met up at this hotel for an overnight stay before our planned cruise. The hotel does provide a complimentary shuttle from MIA airport to the hotel...a huge plus considering cab fare in Miami is ridiculous. A quick call to the front desk directed me to location of the shuttle at the airport. I arrived 3 hours before check-in, so I wasn't expecting my room to be ready (and it wasn't). The front desk attendent politely offered to store my bags and gave me access to the complimentary breakfast buffet (the omelette station was GREAT), access the business center, and pool. The lobby is extremely busy...buzzing with all kinds of people waiting on shuttles, cabs, checking in & out, and waiting on rooms. Definitely no place to relax. The problems didn't start until after I got in my room. The decor and cleanliness of my suite was pretty good. Very spacious and well appointed. However, I guess in the mad rush to prepare rooms, housekeeping forgot to restock toiletries- no tissue, no soap, and no bath towels. There were no extra rolls of toilet paper anywhere in site, and it took forever for housekeeping to bring some. I had to use resort to using the lobby bathroom. No good. Since I was already downstairs, I decided to have a drink poolside at the hotel's restaurant. Since this hotel is so close to the airport, incoming planes looked like they were going to literally land on the roof of the hotel. Noisy is an understatement. Good thing my drink was strong. Napping in my suite was impossible. If it wasn't the loud planes, it was the guests walking by the rooms. All of which I could clearly hear. The walls are extremly thin! You'll need earplugs to get some rest. The Manager's reception with complimentary cocktails was very nice! However the bartenders were clearly irritated and tired. They didn't care if you tipped them or not. So it was a little uncomfortable going back for more drinks. Housekeeping needs to step it up a notch- there were room service trays left in the hallway ALL DAY! I had to call to have them removed due to the funky stinch. If you can avoid the checkout process, do it. The front desk is CHAOTIC during checkout time. I would advise you pay cash upon arrival also. This hotel held almost 30% more than the cost of the room on my debit card and it did not clear until over a week later. THE GOOD: This hotel is located near the MIA airport and fairly close to shopping. It's clean and the decor is pretty. The rooms are spacious and the front desk staff is very accomodating. Complimentary breakfast was great as well as the free drinks at the Manager's reception. THE BAD: Housekeeping needs to do better. For the rate I paid (and it wasn't cheap), I expect toilet paper, soap, and towels in my suite. It's also unacceptable to have nasty, smelly food trays in the hallway all day. THE UGLY: This is a very busy hotel and it's extremely noisy. Sleep was almost impossible without earplugs. Some of the staff visibly appeared to be very unhappy with their jobs. Also they need to do better by clearing their account books faster. A hold on my debit card for over a week is not cool. I will recommend this hotel for a quick layover or overnight stay. Definitely no place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: journeydesigner
Reviews.Content: This was a convenient, clean and comfortable hotel to stay in after our long flight from Australia. We took advantage of the free airport transfer shuttle bus service that also delivered us to the hire car complex the following morning. The complimentary cooked to order breakfast was of a high standard. I was surprised at how close we were to the planes landing at the airport when I looked out of the window because you donâ€™t hear the aircraft noise in the room. We stayed in a two double bed suite with a sofa sleeper in the lounge area, this room was large enough for my husband and I and our two teenage sons. I booked the room via the Hilton website and received a good discount via the advance purchase option.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: sungirlHerts
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with this hotel. Firstly on entering our room we heard the sound of a train horn blaring even though we were on the top but one floor of the hotel,so I made my way to reception to see if we could change rooms and on the way met a member of staff, mentioning the train he informed me that they stopped running at 9pm however I decided to look at getting the room changed anyway. I was offered a room on the opposite side of the hotel and on entering this room a plane was taking of and this was noisier than the train, so as I had been informed that the trains stopped at 9pm I thought it would be best to keep the first room. We had a terrible night as the trains do not stop at night and I think we heard them every hour of the night and after a nine hour flight and no sleep we felt dreadful the next day, not a good start to our holiday, Also we had paid for an upgrade to a high floor although as a hilton honors member this is usually free subject to availibility. I was not impressed with this as it didn't help with the noise problem. We usually stay at embassy suites when visting the USA as we have always found them to be of a high standard but we would not choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: mygraygirl
Reviews.Content: Perhaps if you are part of a cruise/tour you will get better service than the lowly traveler. We arrived at the hotel at 2 pm and were told our 2 rooms were not ready yet. We had a terrible lunch in the hotel restaurant while we waited. Large groups of travelers were filing off busses and immediately checking into their rooms. We checked with the desk often as to the status of our rooms. No one at the desk tried to help, apologize or placate us. By 6 pm we asked for a refund and found another hotel. I guess that customer service really is becoming extinct. Parking is $15 per day and internet access is about that much as well.

Reviews.Title: “I felt safe and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: GailTrinidad_Tobago
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very professional and friendly, the suite was clean and comfortable and I felt very safe at this hotel, the price was worth it. The shuttle to and from the airport was on time, the complimentary buffet breakfast was great, it starts at 6:30am and ends at 9:30am. The use of the computers in the business centre which is open 24hrs. is also a plus for checking emails, etc, note the breakfast and computers are complimentary. I enjoyed a hassle free stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Management should train some staff much better - other locations much nicer.”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveler34438
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many Embassy Suites around US & Canada. After signing off to pay $15.00 to enter property @ guard shack. We pulled to front registration to unload our luggage /after several hour trip in car. Seconds after pulling up large shuttle van. Begins honking / driver steps out hollers you can't park there. I ask where is good to unload luggage? I was motioned to other side of drive. I told the gentleman sorry! Didn't see signs ( there were not any) anyway immediately pull over and by the time I open car door another hotel (embassy suites ) shuttle is behind us. And begins on his horn like a New York traffic jam. Driver says hey you have to move. Told him I was trying to get wife & kid out with luggage. He said not right here. Of course by this time. I was slightly con fussed... I told him look he was crazy if he thought I was dragging luggage though the lot. Why have a gigantic covered pavilion to receive your guests? Only to use for shuttles? I immediately went inside and asked for the person in charge of establishment. Meet Brett ( Manager on duty) told him story above and asked him to get some signs up. To help guests... He said he'd have a talk with the guys. I suggested some training in politeness / helpfulness & receptiveness when welcoming guests. We dragged our bags to our room .... Made it to elevator - finally offered help. Which we refused. Since we had just managed such a mangled reception. We're currently online looking for somewhere that offers a better service for tired travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: mbcher07
Reviews.Content: Obviously I'm not going to complain about the location considering it's the Embassy Suites Miami INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT. Everyone should know you will be hearing airplanes. But check in is at 3pm and we arrived at 3:30pm and were told our room wasn't ready and they would call our cell phone when it was. At 4:15pm we head to the front desk to see how things are going, We come to find out the room was ready and It was pretty obvious they forgot about us. The rooms here are very large and adequate nothing negative to say about them. Room service was a bust (Burgers were cold). But I will say the best part of this hotel is the free hot buffet breakfast in the morning that was a nice start to send us off on our cruise. Even with the front desk mishap & The room service issue I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price I paid”
Reviews.Author: renee462ggg
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites are normally a good place to stay the nite before our cruise but I would not recommend this particular one. The place was clean, the staff was friendly, the managers reception was good and so was the breakfast buffet.: unfortunately they are located in the worst place imaginable, you can't walk anywhere since there isn't a damn thing there! Plus they are directly under the path of the planes landing/taking off at Miami Airport so we heard that all night. I will never go back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value. Just don't make interstate calls.”
Reviews.Author: BackstreetsBack
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this place. I had been comparing MANY hotels in the Miami downtown and airport areas, and I finally chose Embassy Suites because it boasted two room suites and most importantly - free shuttle service to and from the airport, all at a very affordable rate. It was the first time I stayed alone in a hotel and I felt very safe because of the atrium, glass elevators, and two-lock front door. I was very pleased with the excess: 2 rooms, 2 flat-screen TVs, 3 sinks, and even a Nintendo system (although I think you have to pay for it). It is the perfect place to stay if you are looking to be close to the airport. It is also perfect if you are coming back from a cruise and staying in Miami for a few days before you take off. I had disembarked a cruise and took the $10 shuttle from there to the airport, where I knew I would be picked up by the complimentary shuttle to the hotel. It was all very convenient and I love that I didn't even notice/hear the planes shooting by overhead considering the airport is less than a mile away. Also, if you like shopping, the Dolphin Mall shuttle comes by 3 times a day and for $10, you get round trip service. The room(s) were very comfortable and spacious. Although I must admit the decor, specifically the bedding and curtains are a bit outdated and on the tacky side, it all appeared clean and welcoming. I must stress that you not make interstate/long distance calls because you will be charged a fortune. I had made 2 outbound calls both totally about 5 minutes and received a bill for $52! I then proceeded to discuss this with the front desk, who gave me 50% off that bill. That is the only bad thing I can say about this hotel - that it rips you off for making long distance calls. I'm from Canada and I've called my friend who lives in Daytona Beach before. And let me tell you, 5 minutes did not cost me anywhere as much as I was charged, 50% off included. This is a great hotel. I would love to stay here again if and when I have the chance. The restaurant wasn't bad. The steak was good. The salad needed work as it wasn't washed properly. For a hotel that's basically in the middle of nowhere, it offers great value and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As courteous and helpful as you would ever want or need.”
Reviews.Author: kksinner
Reviews.Content: Flight got cancelled out of Nassau, finally found one to Miami, set up rooms online from Nassau Airport to Embassy Suites. When arriving, got on the shuttle, Big Guy was a big help with luggage and knowledge; rooms were waiting. Got in after 8:00 p.m.; went to restaurant and they put on staff, including manager to help take care of guests. Food was great and fairly priced, with friendly staff. With our flights all messed up, we didn't have an outgoing until 7:00 p.m. next day; all we had to do was ask them for the favor of a late checkout and they allowed us to stay until 4:30 p.m.! With eight in our party, including a 4 year old and a 1 year old; it was super the way we were treated. Plus the brunch meal was super and included and Tamara, hostess, was doing her best to show us Embassy Suites hospitality. Our family was definately impressed! Thank you!! Oh, their sign says they want to be the best ES in Florida; if they're not, I want to stay in the one that is! Ken from South Dakota!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: bearbully
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Embassy Suites for a night before our cruise and we couldn't have been more happier. The cab cost us $10 from the airport. This place is very huge and very beautiful. We had a studio room (guess all rooms are studios) with two flat screen tvs, mini refrigerator and microwave. We ordered room service for dinner and that was a nice amenity. The complimentary full breakfast is awesome. Couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “The best for less”
Reviews.Author: catlady25
Reviews.Content: A friend and I, both senior widows, stayed here for only one night, prior to flying out of MIA, heading home at the end of a wonderful visit to southern Florida. We chose the hotel partly because the rates were moderate, and partly because they offered a free airport shuttle. But what we got was a whole lot more!!! It was a place we could easily have been happy staying at for weeks, had we wanted to visit Miami. We actually met a fellow who had been there for a month, and was staying on for yet another month. Firstly, all their rooms have separate bedrooms and living rooms, with microwave, wet bar, and a separate sink , counter, and mirror, outside the bathroom, as well as another inside, so 2 people can be doing their hair, makeup, etc. at the same time. A small balcony is not of much use, other than the fact that you can get fresh air in the room, or can stand out there to smoke, or to watch the planes take off over the hotel. Everything is spotlessly clean, staff are friendly and very helpful. Glass elevators enable you to look down to the main floor restaurants. But the crowning glory was the fact that every evening, from 5:30 to 7:30, they offer free drinks to all their guests. Beer, wine, and well drinks. And every morning, there is a free, cooked to order breakfast buffet, for all guests. On top of what tasted like fresh squeezed orange juice, there are hot and cold cereals, toast, muffins, doughnuts, fruits, etc. plus sausage links, bacon, and eggs cooked to order. They have a long list of filling ingredients, from which you can choose, to go into your cooked to order omelette. It is truly unbelievable value for the money you pay. And everything about they place gives the feeling of a classy older hotel. Our biggest regret was that we couldn't stay longer, as we loved the place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: sueflorida
Reviews.Content: Stayyed here on 2 November with my elderly parents. Did a bit of homework beforehand and requested a quiet room away from the elevator, airport and trains. We arrived to find that all our expectations and requests had been met. The shuttle driver was very polite and had water on hand if required. He also offered to answer any questions about the area. The room was huge which was nice because I had my own space. Only complaint was that the area where the sofabed is felt a little cool but as I watched the election results most of the night it didn't really matter. The bathroom was a good size with a good supply of hot water and toweld galore. We were allocated a room on the 9th floor at the front of the hotel and the airport noise was minimal and not intrusive. We loved the atrium and the breakfast was superb and varied. Did we see real birds in the atrium or is it a clever bit of art work and sound effects? Would definitely go back if we had a flight into Miami and all the staff we came across were cheerful and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel trying to be the best”
Reviews.Author: lotsofslots
Reviews.Content: We chose this cruise post cruise as the pre cruise was lacking. The hotel is very nice and inviting when you walk in. The staff tries to make sure you are welcomed. Mario the bellman is the BEST! All the luggage for 2 families did not bother him. Thanks Mario for your great service. The breakfast was super!!! They have anything you could want. The eve reception is very nice and it was great. The restaurant with the hotel is good. This is a very nice hotel. The one thing I would war is they charge $15 per day for parking. We were not aware of that and it came as a shock on the bill. They do not mention it a check in either so make note. Over all it should be higher on the ratings.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: JoySanB
Reviews.Content: Rooms smelled musty and were dark; hotel is very dated. The day we checked in, multiple room keys did not work so there was a line to get a new key and even the 2nd key did not work, so another wait in the line....its no wonder they did not have opinion cards available at check-out. They should've had additional staff to address the roomkey problem as the 2-person desk staff appeared stressed. The good: Free happy-hour drink & free internet at business-center

Reviews.Title: “It was good enough for the weekend.”
Reviews.Author: JJnCJ
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Embassy the weekend of 10/22/10 - 10/25/10. We were in Miami to see the Steelers/Fins game (GO STEELERS!!). Weâ€™ve stayed in Embassy hotels in the past and figure we could not go wrong. We also wanted to be close to the airport and I admit to other comments about aircraft noise being true, but there was not enough during our stay to be inconvenient. There is some work to be done to touch up the place in some spots, namely the elevators. Breakfast was ok. The happy hour at the end of the day was a very, very nice touch. Unfortunately we did not have time to check out the gym, or steakhouse. One thing I was a little upset about was the $15 a night parking for hotel guests. Had I done proper research I may have chosen another place where parking was included... but having a hot buffet breakfast in the morning without having to search for somewhere to go tipped the scales in this instance. Overall the stay was good, but if we were to travel here again I would choose another hotel since weâ€™ve stayed at this one. It was not badâ€¦just would like to see what others have to offer. The 3rd-4th rate options go from average to very good. I would rate overall in between, so... Overall our vote is - Good

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: whitts1
Reviews.Content: This please very nice, would be better for Free High Speed Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for Airport”
Reviews.Author: Izzitme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night after arriving at the airport. We received a great welcome at reception & were checked in quickly. Room was spacious & clean. Restaurant seemed a bit pricey but room service good value & good food. Bed was comfortable & we had a good night's sleep. Complementary breakfast was good with fresh omelettes & plenty of other food & drinks available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: KentBaz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night twice in September. This is an excellent option for a brief stopover, but not for anyone expecting a "Miami holiday" atmosphere. It's proximity to the airport is the main benefit, although the hotel's facilities are pretty good. Smoking rooms are available (a minor miracle in the USA), although the desk clerk admitted there were only four such rooms out of several hundred, so I think we know where this is heading..... My only complaints - took ages to get an ashtray (sic) and razor sent up to the room, and a requested wake-up call was not provided - fortunately without consequences.

Reviews.Title: “Great One Night Stop Over”
Reviews.Author: 2010HappyTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites on our way from the UK to Costa Rica and we loved it. We waited 30 minutes for the shuttle which was as advertised. The driver was very friendly and we were offered bottled water even though the transfer was only 5 mins. Transfer back to the airport next morning was on time and just as efficient. Reception staff were friendly and efficient and we were checked in very quickly. Our suite was very clean and very comfortable. (Shame about the communal area outside the rooms which had obviously not been vacuumed that day). The Managers complimentary cocktails and breakfast were excellent and great value for money. We ate in the restaurant - food and service could not be faulted. Overall a great place to stopover for its closeness to the airport terminals (we could see the planes taking off and landing from our room but could not hear them). We wish we had been able to break our journey here on the way back to the UK but we had a connecting flight.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great experience at this Embassey Suites.”
Reviews.Author: MichiganTraveler50
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel prior to leaving on a cruise in mid-July. There were 6 people in our party, my husband and I, 3 teenage boys, and grandma. We all had a good experience. The hotel isn't brand new, but we found it to be well-maintained and it had a very Florida feel to it. The swimming pool was very large and crystal clear with a comfortable water temperature. The exercise room was exceptionally well equipped. The free cocktails and snacks in the afternoon were generous, and there was ample seating at breakfast and the food was fine. The beds were comfy, and the rooms were quiet for sleeping. The staff was very attentive and friendly. The location isn't the greatest in terms of nearby stuff, but we had a rented van so we drove to shopping, dining, etc. I thought the hotel was a real value! I've stayed at Embassey Suites in the US and abroad, and have always had a pleasant, enjoyable stay at every one.

Reviews.Title: “Slow service, tired facility, staff who couldn't care less”
Reviews.Author: rocknrolldaddy
Reviews.Content: I knew I had made a mistake the moment I walked thru the door. The facility has layers thick dusty Miami Vice colored paint, water with no cups and it took me over 1/2 hour to be seen by the indifferent staff person. When I said I wanted to transfer to another hilton property he told me I booked thru expedia and the room is non refundable. Meanwhile another "guest" complained he'd tried to get service for an hour and was about to miss his flight. If you hate being treated with indifference and prefer hotels from the 21st century, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Outrageous to charge for wifi.”
Reviews.Author: Silverhonorshilton
Reviews.Content: For 110 dollars it has what you would expect but it is outrageous to charge for wifi especially when the business centre and hard wire connection is free. Also, tables cleared very slowly at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Rooms and Pretencious Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rao_NJ
Reviews.Content: I forced my fiance to book this hotel as I had great experience at Embassy Suites in Seattle,WA Wow was I surprised, First of all we had to wait 1/2 hour for the shuttle despite the hotel just being minutes from the airport, while this was somewhat ok as the shuttle driver was a friendly chap who gave us useful tips about where to go etc, We entered the room to be greeted by the smell of mold which worsened as we entered the bathroom, the ceiling looked like it was chipping in several places due to the dampness, At the breakfast table the manager went around enquiring people about their stay, and she conveniently ignored mewhile I was sitting right in front of her nose, maybe because I'm not a business traveller and they only care about the frequent visitors, Deeply Regret my decision and my fiance swore never to set foot on another Embassy Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as other Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: EUTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights during a tour of Florida. And it is probably not a hotel we would choose again. The hotel is simply not on par with other Embassy Suites. A large number of small things missing - details which together makes a difference to the guest experience. Firstly, the rooms were very spartan decorated - and seemed very worn. And when we arrived housekeeping had forgotten to change the bedding on the sofa bed after the previous guest. And when we came back to the hotel on the second day of our stay our room had not been cleaned. The condiments tray in the room were not refilled during our stay. When I visited the business center two of the computers were out of order. At the restrooms next to the restaurant all soap dispensers were out of soap. In front of the reception there are dispensers with cold water - a really nice thing - but when empty nobody took notice of them or refilled them. And then there was breakfast. It was really a zoo. For some strange reason, this Embassy Suites has decided that ALL people must stand in line for hot items. With the result that you had to wait in the very looong omelette queue even if you just wanted a waffle or a strip of bacon. Other Embassy Suites does a Hot Buffet, so you only have to stand in line if you want cooked to order items. Theese are all small things that it would be easy for the hotel to correct - so I dont understand why they havent done so....

Reviews.Title: “One Smelly Experience had us bouncing from room to room”
Reviews.Author: Maicol67
Reviews.Content: This is a review from a stay over a year ago, so I'm sorry for being late but I had to get it in. My family and I stayed at this hotel as a layover after I was in Miami for a business trip then it was off to vacation, on a cruise. I have stayed in Embassy Suites in Tampa and Las Vegas and very soon ( last week of August ) in Williamsburg Va. The positive: very close to airport and friendly staff and close to local fast food locations. The negative: Once we entered our room it SMELLED AS IF SOMEONE LEFT A DIRTY MOP IN OUR ROOM WITHOUT OPENING THE WINDOWS IN THE DEAD HEAT OF SUMMER FOR OVER A MONTH, OR OF EXTREME MOLD. It was so bad that we could not stay in the room for more than 5minutes. It felt like a ball of mold was stuck in our throats. We immediately informed the front desk and as mentioned before, friendly service, they instantly offered us another room. BUT, I dont know if we had the scent installed in our noses, but this other new room had the same scent. The assistant manager said she did not notice the stench and I looked at her as if she was nuts. They offered to move us to another room and honestly I asked was it the same floor, 7, she said yes and I gave up. So we planted our bags and left our room, hit the pool, shower and out to eat. I know this review is some what old and I am sorry for being late, but now that we are off to Busch Gardens Va, I had to write it. Based on reviews that I see here it seems as if they fixed the problem. And that's awesome. But I know our stay on that particular night, it was horrible, not even the breakfast saved it and we always loved ES buffet breakfast. It just seemed that at that time the hotel needed a major overhaul and again if it has taken place I cant wait to go back. But if my company sends me to Miami again or in general, to a ES hotel, and they will in the last week of August in Williamsburg Va, because that's our choice hotel, I will request to see the room before I sign in. And I hope it is up to sniff, ooops, snuff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFrank
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for the Fourth of July weekend and were treated very well. The shuttle was a little slow...but it was 1:00 AM so I completely understand. Check in was a breeze and we were assigned a tenth-floor room far from the elevator (as requested). There were complimentary water bottles (already in the fridge...nice and cold) in the room for our HHonors Diamond level as well as complimentary Wi-Fi. The room was very clean, cool, and fresh smelling with plenty of towels and lots of toiletries. Breakfast was a little crowded as is the norm for an Embassy Suites on a holiday weekend. The staff did a great job of working the crowd and there were advisories in the elevator telling you the best time to come to breakfast. Food selection was good and the cooks working the omelet line were great. The previous comment as to the staff not speaking English is obviously someone who has not been to Miami before and does not appreciate the charm of our own US-located Latin American city complete with Spanish language primacy and God-awful Caracas-Bogota-Havana-Managua driving practices!! I would not have it any other way! Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Best Breakfast from a hotel I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: Navytravler
Reviews.Content: Our experience started on a bad foot with our pick-up from the airport on a Saturday night (48minute wait). Three other shuttles from different hotels passed us at least twice during our wait. Chatting with others on the shuttle, I found some had been waiting slightly longer than we had. The driver had to leave 10 people behind because there was no room in the shuttle. He called in for back-up after letting them know that another shuttle was being requested. Chek-in was fast and very friendly. The gentleman at the desk answered all our questions. Check-out was even faster; just a simple call to the front desk. The 6th floor room was on a corner and we immediately began to worry about hallway and atrium noise affecting our sleep. Neither was noticed during the night, but conversations could be heard through the bathroom wall. The room was very large and clean. The King size bed was very comfortable and my wife appreciated the five pillows on the bed. We ordered in room service from the in-house steakhouse restaurant. I tried calling three times before someone picked up and politely took my order. The delivery was timely and the food cooked to perfection. The breakfast service we had Sunday morning was the largest and most diverse of any hotel that I have stayed at in recent memory; including our previous week stay at the Hyatt Summerfield Suites near the airport. It was better than what some restaurants offer. The made to order omelets were a treat and I loved the hash-browns and juice selection. Upon leaving, we missed the scheduled airport shuttle by 10 minutes. Another driver agreed to take us right away instead of waiting 20 minutes for the next one. This was a pleasant surprise and made up for the trouble we had getting a shuttle from the airport the previous night. All in all I felt the $107 price was good for what we got. I don't really care what the decorum of the hotel is as long as it is clean, user friendly, and provides good value. I believe you will find all of these at this Embassy suites........plus a koi pond, if you care.

Reviews.Title: “Tamara Szcepanska Help was beyond the call.”
Reviews.Author: michael_d_morrison
Reviews.Content: We had been traveling all day and arrived at this hotel mid afternoon, It was my Wife's Birthday and I requested a Birthday cake in the room. To my surprise I was greeted at the door by Tamara and she had made all the arrangements for me and my wife. The stay was very enjoyable and we also received a discount for the evening meal. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that would be traveling to the Miami area. Thank you for all the help. Michael D. Morrison

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home -Free Breakfast & Happy Hour, Service and Comfort for a great price”
Reviews.Author: mariadunwoody
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic time at the Embassy Suites Miami International Airport with my 3 kids. We were there for 9 days and felt at home whether enjoying the custom omelettes at breakfast or virgin & nonvirgin drinks at happy hour. The suite allowed us to spread out. The business center allowed by son to play video games in a safe environment and my daughter kept up her track training in the fitness center. The pool is open until midnight so we wound down nightly with a lesiurely swim. Hotel Management was always around keeping an eye on things and making sure that all was well.

Reviews.Title: “A quick in and out but very nice and worth it”
Reviews.Author: CodyandJess
Reviews.Content: We used points to stay here and was very worth it. We only were stopping over in Miami on our way back from our honeymoon to do one day of shopping. We grabbed our shuttle to enterprise and found out the embassy is literally across the street which was perfect. We checked in took 5 minutes and no problems. The hotel is dated but it has a retro look and is very clean. When we got to our room it also was dated but also very clean. The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows and the tv was a brand new lcd. We woke up next morning, overslept the complimentary breakfast, and found the room charges printed out slid under our door which was all correct all we had to do was call the front desk say we were leaving and we were out of there. Very comfortable stay. Loved it. Also it was very close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mexiexpert
Reviews.Content: We planned an overnight in Miami to continue on to the Caribbean the following morning. The shuttle promptly picked us up within 15minutes of calling the hotel. We were quickly checked in and sent to our room. The room was very comfortable and spacious. The hotel and facilities very clean and well kept. The next morning we were given a complimentary buffet breakfast that was very good. On our return trip, we had not planned on overnighting but was forced to because our flight was cancelled. We called the hotel and was given an excellent last minute rate. The Embassy was my first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely courteous and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: G45SW357
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels here in Miami and around the world. I rate this hotel in my top 3 for a few reasons. First the room rates are the same as some but lower than the rest. The others with the same rates, well let me just say this one beats them all in all areas of concern. The rooms are nice and clean and well maintained. The breakfast is Awesome! The resteraunt is good, however I think the selection is small. The lounge is GREAT! All of this and a rain forest in the center of everything complete with fish ponds. So you can sit any where in side and enjoy the view. In the evenings they have a happy hour from 5:30 to 7:30 drinks and beer are free. I will continue to stay here when I am in Miami

Reviews.Title: “HOSPTALITY AND PROFESSIONALISM @ IT'S FINEST”
Reviews.Author: warrior49
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed withe staff from the time we checked in until our departure.The breakfast was totally awesome and the cooking and serving staff were so accommodating and polite,the location was perfect. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The Brown Family

Reviews.Title: “Good value, bad location”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter911
Reviews.Content: I met a group of friends before a cruise, and since this hotel was nearby the airport, we figured it would be a good meeting space. The overall value was excellent.. huge, spacious rooms, complimentary breakfast and a manager's reception with free drinks (albeit watered down drinks, but they're FREE so I won't complain). The pool was tiny, but it is an airport hotel, so we got what we expected. Rooms were clean and HUGE, though it's a little creepy because people from across the hotel could see which room you entered. It's not like outside entrances, but at the same time, it's kind of like outside entrances. Whatever, the rooms made up for it. Location was a good meeting spot, but besides that, I got nothing. It was a $30 can ride to South Beach, and the only nearby restaurant was Bennigan's. Front Desk service got the job done, but with little enthusiasm. Also, there is not a shuttle to the cruises, but they will offer to set you up with an outside company.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Captainmommy
Reviews.Content: After a long flight from Europe including additional flight delays we decided to stay here for the night before continuing on to the west coast. The staff was very accomodating and gave us a great rate in the last minute.There is also free shuttle service to the airport. I was pleasantly surprised and delighted with the entire short stay. The rooms were updated, very clean and quiet. The manager's reception was good as always and the bartenders very friendly. But what really surprised me was the breakfast! Better than usual, it was more like a brunch with many selections to choose from. We left feeling well fed, well rested and refreshed. I would definately stay here again when I need a hotel close to the Miami airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay by Airport”
Reviews.Author: Indtraveler44
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Embassy Suites Miami before heading to St Lucia. Used the shuttle to and from the airport and worked out very well. Nothing within walking distance to the hotel. The steakhouse in the hotel is very nice with great food and service, very resonably priced. Drinks in the evening are a nice touch. Room was comfortable and clean. Good place to stop for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised, great service, nice room!”
Reviews.Author: MooneyPilot
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay here after a flight cancellation. Hotel was very pleasant when calling them from the airport at 3AM. The hotel paid for us to take a cab (as they did not have a shuttle driver at 3AM). Upon arrival the front desk gave us bathroom supplies, as ours were stuck on the plane in our bags (deoderant, toothpaste/toothbrush, razors, combs, mouthwash, etc). We checked in quickly and went up to the room to sleep. The room had been recently remodeled and had nice tv's in both the living room and bedroom. I was surprised at how nice this hotel was, as it is an old Embassy Suites design (from the 1980s). The hotel was very clean and had been remodeled, so although the design was old, it appeared to be not so out of date. Breakfast was good, although very crowded due to the airport location and people from all over the world staying there to get on international flights. There were too many people to fit on the shuttle at 9AM, so the hotel got a second driver and added a second shuttle van to the airport. All in all, I was pleasantly surprised at the excellent service and quality of this hotel. I would recemmend this hotel and stay here again if I needed a hotel at Miami International Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: Katecali
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights when our flight was canceled. My kids (4 & 6) LOVED it and have asked if we can go back. First, the cons: plane noise (duh), 15$ parking/day not included with room, hotel has some wear and tear (holes in sheets, carpet tacks sticking up near doorframe). All that being said, we loved our stay, mostly thanks to the excellent service. The check-in counter gave me the quiet room I requested, off the atrium. Tamra at breakfast brought us juice, straws, coffee refills, napkins. The woman who brought the crib was great, as was the repairman for the nintendo problem. I don't think I've encountered such friendly or welcoming staff in years, and I've stayed (rarely) at the Ritz, 4 seasons, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Far below par of typical Embassy Suites....”
Reviews.Author: hodels
Reviews.Content: I choose Embassy often as they are almost always a decent hotel, better than a Hampton but less $$$ than a Hilton. This particular location was just deplorable in the way of cleanliness. I will submit that the staff was accommodating and apologetic with my obvious (yet polite) dissatisfaction. I was nervous from the road even viewing the building, as the upkeep has obviously been neglected. Miami is a tough city due to the heat and humidity, so businesses must take added efforts to avoid mold stains and blackish streaks on stucco structures. This Embassy has been poorly maintained. The lobby failed to strengthen my misgivings, as it seemed dank and in need of a good bleach-scrub in general. Upon getting to my room, the front living area was OK, but the bathroom was just un-usable. I did not even want to use the loo, and it had been since 10am (now 3pm) and I REALLY wanted to! The toilet had disgusting black mold just growing under the rim. The seat appeared to be WET when I lifted the lid! Black mold also was prevalent on the tile grout and near caulking areas of the sink and counter. I literally did not want to TOUCH ANYTHING! I immediately called the Hilton Honors line and was blissfully transferred to the Hilton near the airport, which I will say was quite nice and all I expect of a Hilton Hotel. The Embassy staff did mention that I had requested a lower floor and that the â€˜usually put honors members on floor 10â€™. My comment to this was that the bathroom, whether floor 2 or 10, should NEVER be in that bad of condition....for ANY customer. In all justice, again, I know Miami weather is difficult (while I love Orlando, I generally dislike Miami as I have had many experiences like this with renting cars and the Miami Airport as well â€“ basic lack of general cleanliness), but this is why I book a higher level hotel when travelling there. Most Hampton Inns I stay with are much cleaner than this Embassy Suites, sad, I agree. I now book my travel into and out of the Ft. Lauderdale Airport instead and should have followed my instinct and stayed near that area (the drive is not that bad if you can handle 30-ish minutes to/from a meeting or destination). I urge travelers with little Miami experience to consider areas like North Miami Beach, or even better, the nearby Hollywood Beach, Hallandale Beach, Aventura or Dania areas.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: DFW-Lisa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel to stay at prior to leaving on a cruise from Miami. He is a pilot and stays occasionally at Embassy Suites hotels when working and is usually pretty happy with them. This hotel though was a complete dissapointment. It started with the front desk. There was one woman manning the desk who was engaged in a 10 minute conversation someone who was not checking in. The line grew very quickly as the bus was full coming from MIA. There was no real order to the checking in process and two gentleman got into it over who was next in line (luckily, I was first). Our room was near the elevators so we heard screaming from kids and noise until very late in the evening. Part of the problem was the elevators took forever to move from floor to floor. The room smelled funny but that was probably the "swampy" smell that seems common in Miami. The "managers reception" or whatever it's called was ridiculous. The line for the bar was dozens of people long and the snacks were popcorn and pretzels. I didn't see anything else. The steakhouse was horrid. It took 15 minutes to be seated and another 10 before we saw a waiter. The place was virtually empty. My husband's meal was some sort of bruschetta with bread that was rock hard and didnt resemble any sort of bruschetta I'm familiar with. The shrimp on the plate had to be cleaned as it was not deviened and had the tails attached. The whole thing was just a mess. I told him to send it back and get something else but we were both starving so we ate. While we were eating, there were kids walking back and forth in bathing suits...completely inappropriate. The one thing that did run smoothly was the shuttle to the pier. They were on time and very efficient. I was glad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but you need a car.”
Reviews.Author: tesmar2000
Reviews.Content: Although this Embassy Suites appears a bit older than some, it is maintained well and staff are helpful. The pool area is nice with a lovely cat who makes his home there. The workout area is small and the business center offers a few computers and limited black/white printing. Rooms are decent suites with small microwave, fridge, bar/sink and living room. Beds are comfortable (except for fold out sofa) but biggest concern was that the lone bathroom opens off the bedroom with no access from living room area (we've stayed at other Embassy Suites where the bathroom can be accessed without going into the bedroom) or is accessed from both sides. Seems like a small concern but with 5 of us (2 teenage girls and 3 adults) staying in the room, traffic into the bathroom was constant. The breakfast buffet can be rather chaotic during the peak hours. The hotel offers a manager's happy hour and although they offer a limited selection of mixed drinks, it is rather bland (i.e. popcorn). The biggest draw back to this hotel is that it is very far away from anything and nothing else within walking distance except for a Bennigan's restaurant. We decided to try and catch a bus down to the Bayside Marketplace/Biscayne Bay. This was a challenge as we had to walk approx 3 blocks on a busy street (no sidewalks) then once we caught the bus we had to change buses again in an area that might be somewhat risky especially at night. We used taxis quite a bit and one way to Bayside/Downtown area was $25.00 and about $30.00 to Miami Beach. Great if you have a car but do expect to pay a bit should you want to go sightseeing. The hotel does offer a shuttle to the airport but it does not operate before 06:00 and our returning flight check-in was by 05:00 am. You can take a taxi to the cruise ship but might want to see if anyone else at the hotel is going too as a van is $50.00 and holds 7 people and tons of luggage. So, all in all: nice hotel, bit worn but comfortable and transportation can be a challenge. Staff are accomodating and considering other options in Miami the hotel suite is a value even at their normal, everyday prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, perfect location for proximity to airport”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoChik77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a $10 cab ride (flat fare) from the airport. It's literally about 5 minutes away. You can hear the planes take off from your room, but that didn't bother much at all. In fact, it's expected since the hotel was so close, which is why I figure most people stay here. The room was spacious and clean. There were 3 sinks (including the small wet bar)! We had a king room suite and it fit our needs for the one night we stayed. The location is not good if you're wanting to be near Ocean Ave though. I was amazed at how big the free breakfast was. Definitely a great added bonus to the stay.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: TEEMAC125
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with another couple stayed at the hotel for a "pre-cruise" night. I booked the hotel because it had a separate living room which equals more space! It also had a complimentary breakfast. First, the atrium of the hotel is beautiful, complete with water falls etc. There is a nightly manager's cocktail party....I was expecting premixed drinks....what can you expect for free...WRONG....there were two bartenders mixing drinks....including Long Islands, popping popcorn and serving chips, salsa and cheese dip. For two hours you drank as much as you could...on the house. The complimentary breakfast was exactly what you'd get if you went to a breakfast buffet...I expected microwave sausage biscuits etc... they served biscuits and gravy, pancakes and french toast etc, anything you could have possible wanted. The long and the short of it is we decided we'd be back to stay in Miami (not just a pre-night) and we'd absolutely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pcolon50
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel while I was on business here in Miami for over 45 days. I would like to highlight the customer services provided by Ms. Talita Dias who took care of every single detail to make our stay pleasant. I had a great experience dealing with Mr. Fabien. He works at the front desk and he is very reliable when providing customer services - always willing to help us. Everyone there was very nice to my family specially Tamara (Guest services). Ms. Tamara was always recommending my wife kidâ€™s places. The evening cocktails and morning breakfast were very good as well as the hard workers who were willing to please us at all times. I wish I could remember their names. The room satisfied our needs. We did observe a minor issue with the bathtub. They donâ€™t scrub bathtubs. They spray them with some type of solvent and rinse them with water. So, it was not until we pointed out the issue that the cleaning crew placed a little effort in cleaning the bathtub, but no scrubbing. We ate at the restaurant many times and also ordered food â€œto-go.â€� The food was okay and service was fine. Nothing out of the ordinary. However, the guys that work at the bar were very customer oriented and friendly. We really enjoyed this hotel. All the staff we were in contact with to be very helpful and efficient. As Hilton Honors member I would definitely stay here again. Keep up the good customer services!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experiance”
Reviews.Author: smwarf
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the employees were nice, then when we got to our room the bathroom was not that clean soap scum on the counters mirrors werent cleaned the iron didnt work so we asked to switch rooms which was no prob when we got to the other room same thing dirty counters. Very noicy during the day and night airplanes constency flying out and train so you only get one to two hours of quiet. Walls are thin. The food wasnt that great. You gotta pay for parking which is a rip off since your payin hundred some a night. The Steakhouse was horrible waited for 20mins for a server asked for water 4 times never recived water soda was waterd down steaks were not good chicken was dry waited n hour n half for 2 steaks n chicken breast n they were not busy serive was horrible . The pool was nice didnt like that half the pool was shaded n other half with the sun. housekeeping sucks called house keeeping for toilte paper never anwserd so we called front desk they said they will send someone up after n hour of waiting still noone so We had to find housekeeping our self which is bull crap this hotel is only good if ur flying or going on a cruise the next morning NOT worth staying more then one night. I wouldnt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms and beautiful pool area”
Reviews.Author: KOOTENAYGYRL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel post cruise and prior to flying out the following day. Prior to booking our room I had emailed the hotel asking if we could get a late check out since our flight wasn't leaving until 5pm. I received a quick reponse from Talita Dias who assured me the late check out wasn't a problem. Upon checking in I confirmed with the front desk we had a late check out without any problem. This allowed us to have a quite day at the hotel lounging by the pool. We did have a minor problem with the bathtub. The plug wasn't working properly. The maintainance man came very quickly fixed it and cleaned up after himself. The evening cocktails and morning breakfast were very good. We found the room to be very quiet. It had plenty of room for the 5 of us. The beds are small (doubles I think) not a problem for us but snuggling may be required. We did eat at the restaurant one night the food was okay and service was fine. Nothing fabulous. We probably would have orded room service the next day for lunch but were not willing to pay the large tip added onto the roomservice bill (20%) just for bringing it up to the room. We really enjoyed this hotel. Found the all the staff we were in contact with to be very helpful and efficeint. If I am ever in this area again I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “*** Classy, Update, and Exceptional Hotel All Around ***”
Reviews.Author: Florida3bears
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family during a busy Sunday and service was exceptional. While our room was not quite ready for us- we were offered a room with a view. Our room overlooked the pool area and was very nice. I was very impressed to see that our room had a separate living area with a sofa sleeper, dining table, refrigerator, microwave, sink, over sized chair, and another flat panel TV. We went to the sleeping area where we found our 2 beds, Dresser, Armoire, and another vanity with a sink to get ready or brush your teeth, etc. In the bathroom we had a nice crisp white linen style shower curtain, with sleek black colored cabinetry topped with corion/granite. Moen faucets were used throughout the the room. We had a circular balcony that had enough to seat 3 chairs comfortably. The Complimentary Breakfast was AMAZING! So much to choose from and custom made omelette's to your liking. They also have a Managers Special hour where drinks are offered free of charge. It's from 5:30-7:30 if I recall. Long Island Ice Tea, Beer, Wine, Mixed, etc. Sounded almost to good to be true- except it was for real. So many good things to say. I will for sure stay again at another time in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice airport accomodations”
Reviews.Author: KansasPVgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as an overnite going and coming from Costa Rica. The suites seemed almost brand new, the nicest Embassy Suites we've ever stayed in. Everything was provided and very comfortable. Comfy beds, maybe soft for some but I felt I was sinking into luxury after a long day of flying. No down pillows though. There is an iron & board for last minute preps for your trip, a sink in the bedroom, bar sink in the living room and a sink in the bathroom - all with mirrors. The extra sinks and mirrors made it so much easier for 3 people to get ready for an early morning flight. We would definitely stay here again if we need a jumping off point in Miami. It's such a hassle stopping on the way to somewhere else and these rooms make the experience as luxurious and easy as possible. Flat screen TV's in both rooms for catching last minute news before leaving the country. The buffet breakfast was also just what you would expect, plenty of variety and they will also make your eggs any way you want. You can't go hungry with the variety! The shuttle to and from the airport was on time and the ride takes only 5 minutes from the airport. It runs every 30 minutes. When we returned to Miami we got our luggage just as we figured the hotel shuttle was possibly making it's way back to the hotel and we didn't want to wait 30 minutes. My husband had the number of the front desk and the clerk called the driver before he got back to the hotel so he came right around to get us. Once we were seated on the shuttle, the driver gave us each a bottle of cold water from a cooler next to his seat. On the airport side the planes can be very loud as others have stated. But embrace it and watch from your balcony - it's exciting watching them come and go so close by. After reading reviews I was prepared and brought ear plugs so I had no problem sleeping at all. My husband didn't use earplugs and said he was fine. My son slept in the living room and never heard the planes. Just bring some earplugs and enjoy the otherwise quiet luxury! We also found the staff to be congenial & helpful at this hotel as well. We had dinner in the bar and it was fine. So to keep things as hassle free bring your earplugs and the number of the front desk so you can catch the driver.

Reviews.Title: “Waterlogged rooms, beds unmade, but we were the lucky ones”
Reviews.Author: Luheeg
Reviews.Content: Arrived last night after midnight. Had reserved two rooms so our family of five could spread out after long day of travel. One room had an industrial fan going, clearly trying to dry out some serious water leakage. Carpet still damp. Second room also had a huge fan going. Living room looked fine but bedroom was a wreck! Furniture pulled away from wall. Dirty linens heaped on the bed. A mess! Called front desk. No answer. Went down and was told hotel was sold out so no rooms to move to. Do we opted for 2 roll-away beds to go in the first room to accomodate our whole family in that room. Requested a refund of the pre-paid Internet rate we had paid in full when we booked. I suspect I will have a hard time getting the money back that we are owed. I hope they surprise me with efficient, prompt refund. In my time at the front desk, I met other families who had reservations for the night but we told that all rooms were taken! Returned to my one room with my family and discovered the toilet would not flush and leaked such that there was a continual lake of water on one side of the bathroom. Ugh. But we dared not complain since it was the middle of ge night and we knew we had no other options. At least we had a place to sleep. However, if we wanted a toilet that flushed, we had to go to the lobby! We have two pre-paid rooms booked next week for the return part of our trip and I dread it. Would love to hear some comment from hotel management as to how they could allow this to happen and whether we should expect more if the same when we come back through town. Seriously considered trying to recover the pre-paid booking based on abominable accomodations so that we don't have to go back there. On the plus side, the staff was very nice, very apologetic but this did not make up for the horrendous experience in the least!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest and Friendliest Hotel Stays Ever”
Reviews.Author: mainecruiser_10
Reviews.Content: When traveling to Miami, FL, we ALWAYS stay at this Embassy Suites. Pricing is reasonable, ambiance is very nice, and the staff is super-friendly. I'd like to especially mention Tamara (hostess) and Mario (concierge). I believe we get more than we are paying for. From the morning's fully cooked to order breakfast, to the good size outdoor pool, to the accommodations, to the manager's 'Happy Hour,' and the convenience to the airport and cruiseport - who could ask for anything more?

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stay in Miami”
Reviews.Author: AlanH16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights as an overnight place going into the Caribbean and back. As an airport hint, there are two levels of parking/bus travel at the airport. Embassy Suites vans use the upstairs level. This will save you about $12 if you use one of the cabs in the lower level. Everything was up to Embassy's standard of excellence; helpful staff, the plush gardens on the ground floor, and generally excellent food service. The van service back and forth to the airport is very helpful. Our room had a couch, internet service, and TV's in the living area and a double bedroom. We experienced no noise problems and we were right in front of the elevators one night. The view of the Miami skyline at night was gorgeous. There were only two quirks that kept me from giving this a 5 star rating. The beds seemed somewhat small. I had to be careful rolling over while sleeping with my wife. I almost rolled out of bed a couple of times. The couch rolls out to make another bed, so the three of us had our own bed. Thus, this wasn't too bad of a problem. The other thing that seemed strange involved the night-time restaurant. We were dining about 8 at night. The food was decent and served without any problems. We were seated more outdoors with a wall separating the restaurant and the lake. What was unusual was when the busboy came by, glanced around, and placed the dirty dishes behind the wall! At first, we thought he had placed the dishes in the pond itself, but evidently there is a ledge between this wall and the pool. It appears when there are enough dishes; they bring the cart around to be cleaned. Time saver? Perhaps. It just seemed strange to see when it happened right in front of us. Otherwise, we had a great stay. When we return to Miami, this will definitely be our hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay---great staff!”
Reviews.Author: annasmom73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the end of our FL vacation. The staff, as other reviewers have noted, are gracious and so helpful. Upon arrival at the gate, the security attendant suggested we return our rental car that evening to save us the parking charge; which we took him up on. I returned the car, and the hotel sent a van right over to get me at the rental car agency, which was about a mile away. Then we realized we forgot my husband's sunglasses in the car, and they drove him back there, for free--no issues! We got room service for dinner, and it was very good. The room was nice, my biggest complaint was the noise. All of the rooms look over the atrium/bar/restaurant area, and it was girls night out, apparently. Some women were screaming and laughing and having a great time while we were trying to get our toddler to sleep. We tried running the fan on the thermostat, but it kept shutting off, so we didn't have a lot of white noise to drown it out. Fortunately, they all went to bed around 10 pm. I would suggest if you have trouble sleeping to bring a white noise machine; we heard the trains allllll night, and didn't get a very restful sleep. The fan, even on Hi or Lo went off and on all night. The pool area was very nice, and the workout room was great! We used the business center to print out our boarding passes, and everything worked great. Overall, it was a very nice hotel very near to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: PaulL6
Reviews.Content: amazing service, incredible breakfast and fun out by the pool and in the hottub

Reviews.Title: “Miami Trip”
Reviews.Author: Bill_Shelton
Reviews.Content: Wonderful greenery in Entry area. Good food and service. Warm bed, firm mat and wonderful people.

Reviews.Title: “Okay except for restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Kitsilano
Reviews.Content: After 12 hours of travelling, we made the mistake of settling for the in-house restaurant at 10pm: big mistake. Disorganized and slow service, meals borderline edible. Food poisoning ensued. Luckily too nauseated to look for breakfast, which didn't start until half an hour after we had to leave for morning flight. Room, cleanliness, etc. were up to Embassy Suites standards; morning shuttle to airport was timely and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and great location”
Reviews.Author: millon9
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night, would definetly stay again. A little hard to find, but once ya know where you are going it's not bad. Shuttle to/from airport which runs every half hour I believe. Very beautiful lobby, and breakfast area. Rooms are wonderful, and quite spacious. The breakfast in the morning was very very tasty. Gym is AWESOME.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding from entry to exit.”
Reviews.Author: wphillips3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night after returning from cruise. Checked in early (3 hours), but we were treated like we had been staying there for a week. They held or baggage, took our cell number, directed us to the pool and a place to change clothes and called us when the room was ready, (two hours before normal checkin of 3PM). Staff couldn't have been nicer. The two hour complimentary cocktails was fantastic, we mingled and talked with other guests who were equally impressed with the service. The bartendars were great. The breakfast the next morning was unbelievable, better even than the cruise ship offered. I would and will diffinitely stay there again. Great Job.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, TERRIBLE shuttle service for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Azrea1
Reviews.Content: I waited for OVER an hour at the Miami airport after arriving at midnight. During that time the Embassy suites shuttle came once, but was so full people were crammed against the door. The driver said, "another shuttle is on the way." While I waited for the "other" shuttle, I watched most of the other airport hotels' shuttle go by TWICE. Finally, the shuttle (with the driver I saw the first time) came back and was able to fit us in (now past 1 AM). When we drove up to the hotel I saw TWO hotel vans parked outside. I brought up the long wait to the front desk and the man behind the desk said, "Oh." I further brought up my displeasure at seeing TWO other vans which could have been used sitting parked outside their hotel when they are an airport hotel. The primary purpose of an airport hotel is to provide quick and easy transportation to the airport. He responded by giving me "free" breakfast coupons. IT'S AN EMBASSY SUITES HOTEL!!! BREAKFAST IS ALWAYS FREE!!! To add to this, I tried to do some laundry and had to run around a number of times to find an open washing machine.
