Then when I finally found one and put my clothes in, someone took my "clean" clothes out and put them on the floor. Granted, this isn't exactly their problem, but it still happened under their watch. The dryer next to the washer I had used was occupied because the guy said someone had opened the door to see if his clothes were dry (to presumable throw his clean clothes on the floor and get started sooner), but they hadn't closed the door completely so his clothes were still wet. I went down 4 floors and found an unoccupied dryer, but this mean the person using the washer next to THIS dryer had to go up two floors to use a dryer. I like Embassy suites usually, but I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great value, superior service”
Reviews.Author: lesliz64
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before our cruise. The manager's reception with free cocktails was great. We decided we wanted to go into South Beach to eat dinner and asked the young man at the front desk for suggestions. He made several and we decided on Emeril's. He indicated that he knew the host there and would call ahead for us and make reservations. We arrived via taxi (approximately $35.00 cab fare from the hotel) and the hostess welcomed us and said they were expecting our party. We were seated immediately at the best table in the restaurant. We had a few more requests and the staff was happy to accommodate our requests. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise hotel with generous amenities”
Reviews.Author: Snarth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites Hotel-- Miami Airport for a business meeting that was also housed at the hotel. From the beginning I was pleasantly surprised by the shuttle driver (offered bottles of water to all riders), the friendly staff, and the upbeat tropical decor of the hotel, atrium and rooms. The breakfast was very generous for a freebie-- all kinds of hot and cooked to order items-- and the liberal pouring of free drinks after 5:30 can't be beat. I agree with previous reviews that the living room/ work areas of the suites are a bit dim and dark. Also, there needs to be more attention to little things like, in a 3 room suite, you need more than 1 trash receptacle. Nonetheless I have no major complaints about this hotel which was quite pleasant and seemed genuinely concerned for guests' comfort and convenience. Other posters have commented on the airplane noise. I would add that this hotel is also very close to a railroad track, and the horns of trains could be heard at all hours. I actually found this quite pleasant (I love train sounds), and even though I am a light sleeper I was not awakened by any of the planes or trains, but other travelers might want to keep it in mind-- it is not what you would call a quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “For the money, this is a very,very nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: FrankHW
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Miami for a four day trip to see her son and do some sightseeing. (First time in Miami) Arrived at the hotel about 10AM. We left our one suitcase in area provided and were told by friendly male desk clerk that he would call when room was ready. He called about 1PM to tell us room was ready. Great news, since check-in is not until 3PM and we were tired and wanted to get in the room and unpacked. Our stay was Saturday through Tuesday so we experienced the rush at the breakfast on weekends and the VERY relaxed proceedings on weekdays. The only problem we had regarding breakfast is that although the food is hot when served, it gets cold fast due to the atrium area being very chilly. Suggest you wear either a long sleeve shirt or a sweater. Room was fine...nice and big but the sitting room is dark. This is an airport hotel, people, so if you don't like a lot of noise coming from the sky my advice to you is stay somewhere else. You have HUGE planes coming over the hotel at less than 1000 ft so figure it out. Very attractive inside and out. I would certainly stay here again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect A+++”
Reviews.Author: clstraveler
Reviews.Content: The staff were very professional, my room was very clean, and the cleaning service was excelllent..The breakfast buffet was good and the managers reception was nice...good drinks, popcorn and snacks. Added perks, hotel airport shuttle, shuttle to the nearby mall, and an onsite car rental... Overall I was very pleased and i will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location; otherwise weak”
Reviews.Author: sagecrest
Reviews.Content: Free shuttle service from airport to hotel botched by hotel. After three calls and much time, hotel advised to take a cab to hotel at hotel expense. Must use blue colored cabs for fairly short ride. Nice architecture, worn facility needing refurbishment top to bottom. Room service trays in hallways....still there in the morning. Fair sized room but very dark with old style curtains. Granite countertops, good linens...all else needs major remodel. Hair (not ours) in shower/bath combination. At breakfast, food in hot trays wasn't hot. Somewhat icky synthetic coffee. Fresh fruits available. Shuttle from hotel to port for $10/per person...schedule in advance. Some staff great....some mediocre. Nice business center with free Internet using four terminals. Can print boarding passes. Happy hour included good bottled beer and mixed drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites MIA”
Reviews.Author: jdawsontx
Reviews.Content: Rooms were marginal. Very crowded at breakfast buffet. Pretty noisy right by airport.

Reviews.Title: “The Worse Hotel Experience Of My Life”
Reviews.Author: Bruise01
Reviews.Content: Thirty Minutes to check-in because they were overbooked even though I had a reservation for months. Desk Attendant had to run up to the fifth floor to see if a clean room was available. Room was never cleaned by housekeeping. I had to go get towels and toilet paper off the housekeepers cart everyday. Calls to the front desk and housekeeping went to voicemail and calls were never returned. The common restrooms in the hotel were filthy. Trash was not emptied and no toilet paper. I have contacted Hilton's customer service several time and all I am getting is lip service minus customer service. The only pluses is that it is a nice hotel in general and the staff managing the breakfast bar did a good job.

Reviews.Title: “Worst managed hotel I've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: Hawks80
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Miami, Florida for this year's Orange Bowl. We stayed at this Embassy Suites and experienced probably the most disorganized and rude staff in the hotel industry. Our room was not cleaned for over two days (I finally had to specifically request it), the wait at the front desk was often more than a half hour, and the hotel was generally ill-prepared to handle very many people. We specifically stayed at the Embassy Suites because before booking we asked the hotel staff if a shuttle to Landshark Stadium would be provided. We were told "if enough people need one" that it would be no problem, as they have airport shuttle drivers on staff. The hotel was full of travelers for the game, as evidenced by the fact that two out of three people were wearing their team's clothing, yet when we arrived we were told no shuttles would travel to the game because "it is too expensive". When I suggested that they charge for the ride, it was refused because "we don't have enough drivers". I opened up a complaint with Hilton, only for the manager to leave a curt message at our room restating their position. This is, in a word an awful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but not great”
Reviews.Author: Jamaicanyardie
Reviews.Content: Hotel is really close to Miami airport which is convenient. Rooms are big and fairly comfortable. When we were there however the hotel was full and they seemed understaffed so there were long lines at the front desk and the free breakfast was like a zoo on both mornings we ate there. I would try again to see whether this was just a one off bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Atrium VERY VERY VERY noisy”
Reviews.Author: klingquaad
Reviews.Content: I'm actually in the hotel as I type. There has been drunk guys in the atrium area for the past 3 hours screaming, yelling and roaring keeping everyone else in the hotel from sleeping. I do not blame the drunks for being loud, I blame the hotel for not telling them to keep it down for they might not realize how loud they are being. I'm on the room phone trying to reach the front desk for the fourth time and it just rings and rings and rings. After 5 minutes of ringing I just give up. This hotel has potential, but the lack of care for the guests really kills the experience. I'll try calling the front desk for the 6th time now but I doubt I will get any response. Frustrating. If you book here, you are risking not sleeping. I didn't. This is NOT the embassy suites that you would expect. The lack of customer service kills it.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Quality”
Reviews.Author: NCStateTraveler
Reviews.Content: Flew into Miami around 9:30pm. Got our bags and waited for the shuttle. It took about 5-10 minutes (a little after 10pm) for the shuttle to arrive which is a very acceptable wait time for a hotel shuttle. Driver was not overly friendly but professional enough. We have stayed here before and the lobby is very tropical and nice. The sound of the rushing water is a very calming sound to hear and drowns out a lot of other noises. It would be great if all hotels were layed out like this! It was kind of late and the check-in desk did not greet us immediately, but we were helped in a very speedy manner. When i say speedy it wasn't the friendliest, but we were in our room before 10:30. The room was just like the pictures on the Embassy Suites website. Kind of dark colors, but very nice and granite counters. The bedroom does have some brighter colors, and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was clean and nice. Not sure if I missed the sign, but it took me a little while to find the ice machine (even floors). Odd floors have laudry facilities. Did not use pool/hot tub facilities this visit. When we woke-up breakfast had started and the US Today was at the front door. Breakfast is very good at most Embassy Suites and this Embassy Suites does not disappoint! Check-out had a small line so I used a kiosk downstairs. Two taxis were parked out front and we were on our way the the cruise terminal! To summarize, this is a great Embassy Suites. It did not blow my socks off and my few interactions with staff were not as friendly as last time, but it is a very consistent place to rest your head! If you are wanting a place near the South Beach action this is not it, but if you need a one night stay before or after a flight this Embassy Suites delivers what you need.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: linetc
Reviews.Content: I actually live in Miami but decided to get away with the kids for a weekend. We had such a wonderful time. The lobby makes me feel like I was in another place with it's lush tropical garden. Also rooms were much more than I expected and breakfast was greattt! We didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “VALUE PLUS !”
Reviews.Author: travalinman32
Reviews.Content: Shuttle from the airport to the motel was slow, but the rest was worth it. Very clean, roomy and accomodating. Excellant staff and service. Restaurant was pricey, however, the quailty of the steaks were top shelf and you get what you pay for. On the neg. side, stingy on the side dishes and the staff needs more training. Business was slow and the staff was slower. Had to ask for water and silverware, and she only brought one water. No rolls or bread were available with the meals. As for the continental breakfast, it was great. Sure it was crowded, but what can one expect when it is free. See you next trip to Miami. Mr. & Mrs. E. Brown

Reviews.Title: “1 Night Stay Ticked All The Boxes”
Reviews.Author: SandalsPrincess
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone We stayed at the Embassy Suites for 1 night on Tuesday 29th September with my husband and son aged 2. We were dropped at the hotel with the free shuttle bus provided by the hotel, the guy who drived the bus said he would give us a card for 15% off the restaurant at the hotel, but once we arrived he never did, strange. Anyway we get checked in and head to our room, we had 4 cases, 2 backpacks, a trunki and our 2 year old! Yeah we travel light, we get to the room and the key does not let us in, we tried a few times until a handyman came to the room and asked why we wanted in there, I said thats the room we have been allocated, but they gave us the wrong room instead, so more waiting about and we were given the right room! Its not a major deal just wanted to mention that. The room was great, very spacious, had a seperate living room with tv and bedroom with tv. We head straight downstairs for the reception cocktails from 5.30pm - 7.30pm. The lady behind the bar was amazing, very polite and friendly. We would leave a tip in the glass at the bar for her as she worked really hard for the 2 hours. I had vodka and orange, my husband had beer. Other people were having cocktails, wine, you name it it was there, ok the vodka was Gordon's vodka which I havn't heard of in Scotland but it tasted great. There was free popcorn and pretzels where you could help yourself. We headed back to our room for an early night to prepare for our flight home after a great time in Miami South Beach, cruising on Liberty and then the Florida Keys, so this hotel was a happy ending to our vacation. In the morning we headed down for our cooked breakfast, the lady took ages to make my eggs sunny side up, when she gave me them she said sorry and said if I wanted to wait for another one, I had already waited 10 minutes so could not wait as our toddler was playing up! Apart from the little negatives it was a great hotel and we would stay again! Thanks for taking the time to read my review.

Reviews.Title: “The most bang for the buck.”
Reviews.Author: Rico43
Reviews.Content: My wife and I initially booked our room online for one night only, not sure if we'd want to stay a second time. After one night, we knew we'd found a home in Miami, and Karin, the front desk manager, and the two young men assisting her went beyond the call of duty to help us book our second night's stay at the same rate we'd gotten online for our first night. The rooms, with two giant flat-screen TVs, were spacious, spotless, nicely laid out and contained all the basic amenities anyone would require. The two young ladies tending bar for the evening happy hour (free drinks) were only surpassed in graciousness and helpfulness by Tamara at the a.m. breakfast buffet. Aware that I was suffering from a cold, Tamara fixed up an order of tea, honey and lemon for me to take back to my room. The eggs cooked-to-order breakfast (also free) was as fine as one could ask for away from home. The 12 o'clock noon checkout allowed us to pack in a leisurely, unhurried manner and the young lady who drove us to the airport in the hotel shuttle provided free bottles of ice water. Anything else? Oh yeah, the young Asian lady in the gift shop went out of her way to help me purchase the right phone card and even loaded it into my cell phone. Our stay at this hotel was outstanding in every way and I'd recommend it without reservation to anyone visiting Miami. One last thing, if you get hungry pass up the Bennigan's around the corner and order the Chinese food from the menu found in the hotel services binder in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, highly recommended hotel!”
Reviews.Author: epiclesis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the night before our cruise out of Miami. They had a complimentary shuttle pick us up from the airport and provide us with bottled water. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. Free alcoholic beverages were provided for a couple hours in the evening, and an extensive breakfast buffet in the morning. The rooms were fantastic and roomy and very well set up. The hotel concierge was very helpful and got us very reasonable transportation to the port. The price was equivalent to what I've paid for a very low quality hotel. Very impressed and definitely would stay again and recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel despite problems with electronic key system”
Reviews.Author: bfr1478
Reviews.Content: Our stay there was great even though their entire electronic key system was down. The food was wonderful, the rooms were without flaw. The pool area was very enjoyable. They had a complete breakdown of their door lock system, but they handled it very well. They had employees located on each floor with master keys, and due to the fact that they rooms all face the balconies over the interior courtyard it was easy to signal to someone that you needed to be let into your room. We asked for and received a discount for our inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay before/after cruise”
Reviews.Author: Love2GetAwayChicago
Reviews.Content: Free shuttle from airport to hotel. Personnel scheduled a van with a trailer to take our group (2 families with 6 teenage girls) to the cruise ship. Driver even stopped by Walgreens for us to get a couple cases of water before boarding the ship. Breakfast buffet was outstanding. Lots of variety; hot foods, fruits, cereals, breads, etc. Very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable oasis in a chaotic area”
Reviews.Author: DavidSAshland
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we stayed here. We have returned again for the service. Specifically, Juan Carlos and Tamara(sp). On this trip, we were greated by a man offering to help us with our luggage (nice touch). The frontdesk staff was prompt and courteous. Our room was nice, clean and spacious. Breakfast in the morning was amazing. The service was great. Tamara went table to table making sure everyone was taken care of. Basically, I was amazed by the level of service at this hotel. I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities for the price”
Reviews.Author: bookmommy0406
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel. The decor makes you feel you are in Miami, the rooms are very clean and updated, comfortable. The breakfast was delicious, and Tamara went beyond her job description in being helpful to my husband who was in a cast. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great people, comfy room, great steaks, building needs TLC”
Reviews.Author: tlhjar
Reviews.Content: Good things: Check-in at front desk. I never saw the shuttle and took a cab, so he gave me a bag of nice treats, a movie coupon, and refunded my cab fare. Room service: their steaks are awesome. Menu is on the pricey side and limited, but Barcelona Steakhouse knows steaks! Crab cakes are very tiny, though, and steak/avocado salad turned out to be mostly tomatoes, which I don't like. Living room is very comfy, with sofa, TV that you can turn, and table/chairs. All of the staff are very nice. I finally found where they sell Starbucks (between restaurant and bar), and they gave me a great cup of expresso. Our conference room was good. Needs work: bathtubs, some stained fabric, shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: TeamMom25
Reviews.Content: I made arrangements for a group to stay at the Embassy prior to cruise. The group and I enjoyed staying at the Embassy Suites MIA. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the hotel itself was awesome. Breakfast was great and the Manager's Cocktail hour, well lets just say, yall know how to throw a party. I coordinated a Meet & Greet for the group which worked out well during the Cocktail hour. We had to get last minute shuttle service to the pier from the hotel and the front desk got us a shuttle for 24 people in 15 minutes. I would highly recommend this hotel. Debbi - Waldorf, MD

Reviews.Title: “outstanding hotel staffs”
Reviews.Author: dhscbp
Reviews.Content: This was my first business trip to Miami. I have expected a decent quality of hotel and services as I arrived to the hotel it was totally unexpected the service was very excellent and the front desk clerks was very professional and very helpful. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodations at Great Rate”
Reviews.Author: dealmaker
Reviews.Content: The suites are well decorated and very spacious.Wonderful for business traveler. Suites lack in room safe. Recommend Elsafe that holds a laptop. Public areas are dated and need to be refreshed. Friendly staff. $15 parking fee excessive for guests staying at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: apinet
Reviews.Content: I'm very disappointed with this Embassy property. I stay in many different Embassies but this is the worst I ever stay. First they gave me a dirty room. I request a change of room and with out any problem they change me to another one but to my surprise the A/C never work. The temperature inside the room never drop below the 75 degrees. The smell at humidity was really strong. We were so tired that we decide to stay on that room and check out inmediatly n the morning. Looks that all room s have the same situation because I here comments from other customers. Too bad for an Embassy suites. By the way the breakfast staff was really good as well at the breakfast itself. I will say that the maintenance in this property is really poor. Don't stay smell bad and rooms are hot and humid.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a family of 4 near the airport”
Reviews.Author: eldeesilver
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night to catch a moring flight in Miami. The only downside is they charge for parking. Rooms were clean. There is a main room with pull out bed couch, table, TV and bar. The other room had 2 twin beds and a TV. Perfect for my wife, me and our 2 teens. A great value over booking 2 hotel rooms. Breakfast was great and included. Airport Parking Tip: Don't leave your car at Ace/Contential off airport parking. It is a dumpy operation and they lost my car and keys. Took them an hour to find.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre cruise stay!”
Reviews.Author: jascar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy suites the night before our cruise and everything was very nice. We had the Pre cruise package so we had shuttle service from airport to hotel and then from hotel to the port. There is a breakfast included with the stay and it was very good. The children used the pool in the morning after breakfast before we left and it was very nice. The rooms are very spacious and clean. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The staff go above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: SeanRORD
Reviews.Content: Even when I made the mistake in a reservation - they team here took good care of me and said "We all make mistakes" what can we do to fix it. Always resonable and personable when I visit. CHEERS! SEAN

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Property!”
Reviews.Author: ClarkJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here after our cruise and loved it. We were a little leary about the property, because it was very close to the airport but the only time u heard a plane was when you were on your balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite your avg Embassy Suites (in a bad way)”
Reviews.Author: BusTraveler09
Reviews.Content: First off this ES is located right next to the airport which is good but its in the rough part of town. The property is surrounded by a tall iron fence. I didn't want to leave for dinner so I tried the hotel restaurant....and was very disappointed. It was expensive and the meal was just average. The breakfast the next morning was good but there was a lack of tables to sit at. All in all I would say this is a sub-average Embassy Suites in a rough part of town. The only up side it that it is only 5 minutes from the airport but you don't hear the airplanes all night.

Reviews.Title: “Who knew!”
Reviews.Author: CHUBABY
Reviews.Content: This place was like a palace! The rooms were spacious! You couldn't beat the price for the convience of being so close to the airport! You wouldn't know there were airplanes around because the rooms must have a sound barrier. Only time you would hear or see them if you went out to your balcony. I loved the overall look. It was raining most of the time we were in Florida but we didn't mind because the tropical look inside the hotel made you feel like you were on the beach! The staff were accommadating and the evening reception(which was free by the way) Was off the hook! The bartenders made whatever you wanted. You were able to socialize with people all over and then go back to your room in minutes. The breakfast made to order(which was free by the way) was exquisite. Omlettes made how you wanted them full breakfast with everything you can imagine and it went on until 10:30 for those who got up late and early enough for those who were coming in 6:00 am ahem.......(not the hot breakfast but cereal, oatmeal, danishes fruit coffee etc......But the hot breakfast....yum pancakes, sausage, bacon, omlettes, scrambled eggs, fruit, biscuits diced potatoes! You name it they had it!!!!! I really enjoyed this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: crazygecko
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here as a friend was flying in late and we were heading off early the next day so it really was just a stop over for us. That being said the hotel room was very spacious and clean and looked just like the hotel photos. As Hilton Honours members we also got free bottled water in the room. The complimentary breakfast was very good with a wide variety to choose from. Even though outside airplanes were flying non-stop overhead and were very loud, inside you could barely hear them and sleeping was not affected in the slightest. This hotel is not near the beaches or the action of central Miami but if you are looking for a hotel close to the airport this is definately one to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: ngphilpot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Rum Renaissance in nearby Miami Beach. While the hotel itself looks like it could use a total makeover (some minor renovations were going on in the lobby during our stay), the rooms are very spacious and nice. The guest rooms were outfitted with modern decor and furniture and even featured 2 HD TV's! The famous complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast & buffet and the Manager's Reception did not disappoint. Just don't be late because they shut everything down on time. The business center, although filled to capacity during peak hours, made most technological perks available and even made airport check-in a breeze! The staff was amazing, always checking on your satisfaction and just being generally helpful with just about everything. The best part of this hotel, to me, was the spotless fitness center, which featured modern machines, weights, equipment, and entertainment. My only squawk, which really doesn't count, is how far away it is from 'the action' in Miami Beach. But, I knew that when I booked so it's not really the hotel's fault. Overall, I had a nice time and I would return if getting to the beach wasn't a priority!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and freindly staff, if you don't mind mildew smell in A/C”
Reviews.Author: par0574
Reviews.Content: paying for WiFi is a rip off! Great location and freindly staff, if you don't mind mildew smell in A/C

Reviews.Title: “Kind of gross....”
Reviews.Author: albeeee
Reviews.Content: Hotel was just dirty everywhere, pizza boxes and take-out bags near elevators overnight, our room was dirty with plastic and paper wrappers, doors were all touched up with mis-matched paint, spackle on door frames, AC doesn't even get to the bed are.Service at dinner was slow, Caesar salad we shared for 3 of us, it was placed on the center of the table, no side plates or silverware, had to ask, nobody spoke English. Close to airport yes, but only good if you can get it under $80.00, need major renovation

Reviews.Title: “Not if you want Internet Access”
Reviews.Author: Nautonnier
Reviews.Content: I am in hotels almost every week and make considerable use of high speed internet access for both business and liesure. I was aked to go to the Embassy Suites near Miami airport for an organized meeting. The hotel is in amongst the network of feeder roads into MIami Airport and is of the type with an internal atrium with balconies with the rooms off. Check in was no problem and then to the room to get a document to a customer. I then found that the internet was $12.95 A NIGHT or $90 a week. Not only that but the rate only applied to one computer - if you wanted to use a second computer as I do for non-work/small business, it is charged again - so my stay was going to cost me $100 for 4 days internet access. I believe that the hotel relies on single night stop business accouint holders who will pay $12.95 and charge it. It starts getting too painful though for more than one night or more than one computer. This is really not worth it when there are many hotels in the area probably more suitable for business with easier access.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, But Housekeeping Could Improve”
Reviews.Author: kkmonga
Reviews.Content: We had a one night post-cruise stay at the Embassy Suites Miami Airport. The staff was very accomodating finding us a room somewhat earlier than scheduled check-in. Our suite was as described; two rooms with double beds, balcony, living area, and kitchenette. Our first impression of the room was the humidity. The carpets were damp, and the room wouldn't cool properly. We attributed it to the room perhaps being open for housekeeping, but the moisture problem never resolved. Other guests remarked about the same problem. The bathroom was large and well-supplied with towels and toiletries, but was in dire need of more thorough cleaning and had maintenance issues. The toilet under the rim was caked with black stains that were obviously "organic" and not hard-water stains. The toilet seat was loose, as was the flush handle. The toilet itself made more noise than the one we had on the ship! We couldn't even flush after everyone else went to sleep for fear of waking them or the neighbors. The tub was worn with obvious mildew in the tile grout and caulking. The shower head was one of those unfortunately low-placed heads that you had to duck under while showering (I'm only 5'4".) They would be wise to change it to a hand-held model that could be mounted higher. The microwave was not working, but we were not in dire need of it. The on-site restaurant was good, but a little pricey. Room service costs were higher than at other Emabassy Suites locations we had stayed before, plus they add 20% gratuity and a $2.50 delivery charge. Tryas were not picked up promptly (our neighbor's breakfast dishes sat in the hall until 10PM.) I got a good room rate for the night, but I would definitely like to see improvements made before I stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suite - Okay, But Overall Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Christal1
Reviews.Content: 2nd half of a 4 day post cruise stay in Miami was at Embassy Suites. The first half was at Homewood Suites, Blue Lagoon, Miami. (See Homewood review) We arrived for an early check-in on Sunday morning to be told no rooms available and an offer to hold our bags. Then suddenly, there was a room available. We could check in early even though they normally charge for early check-in, but this was waved for us. Since I assumed being a Hilton Honors would get me an early check-in I was somewhat taken aback by this statement. Maybe it's my Starwood or my Marriott membership that does this. We checked in about the same time two days prior at Homewood with nothing said about early check-in other than they did have a room available for us. None-the-less, I was glad to be checked in our room so we could head out to Aventura Mall to go shoe shopping! My initial impression of the hotel driving in was a positive one. We signed up for $15 per night parking. There is lots of greenery and palm trees in the landscaping providing for a soothing and calming effect. The hotel is an older Embassy Suites. I have not stayed at one in a few years and could tell the age. However, it is the typical Embassy Suites with large window suites surrounding an atrium planted with an abundance of palms and other greenery, ponds with Koi fish, waterfalls, walk-ways, and plenty of tables for mingling. Our one bedroom suite was typical of the hotel chain, but after Homewood Suites with a kitchenette, I felt somewhat short changed since I was now paying for parking and a higher rate for the room. However, I was looking forward to breakfast in the morning. We unloaded, checked out the pool which was landscaped and gave a nice impression of a garden, and headed out to Aventura Mall to window shop and look at shoes. We were back in time for the free cocktails. The two teenagers went to the computer room to do whatever they do and we headed down to the free cocktail reception in the atrium. There was a long line for two bartenders. After a 20 minute wait we each ordered two margarita's and found a table to drink and buddy talk. We went to the computer room where we were notified by hotel staff that the two teenagers (age 13 each) could not be in the computer room alone without an adult. I told him I would be on another computer and he promptly insisted that I had to be on one computer with the minor. Which meant that I couldn't do what I wanted to do. Then he said no one was waiting now and it was okay. Ummm, I wonder why he came in the first place if no one was waiting or reported the girls who had been calmly utiizing two of the four computers. Since one of the girls was doing homework on a special project due when she returned to school later in the week, I felt this was just as important. I asked the front desk if the teen could do homework and they told me yes. Though disappointed with the girls not being able to use the computer like they did at Homewood, I was pleased with that response. However, I made sure they did not go back down to play on the computer--only do homework for no more than an hour. Imagine a 13 year doing homework on their own while they are on vacation in Miami. Later that night, we learned that we could not control the temperature. We turned it up as high as it could go (80 degrees) and it NEVER got warm. Not really warmer either. We froze all night and we are from the mid-west and used to the cold. The two double beds in the bedroom were nice and comfortable, but we were cold with the thin blankets. The girls on the sofa sleeper were apparently cold also because they called housekeepping the next evening and asked for an extra blanket which was brought to them after a slight delay and a 2nd call. Breakfast was good--not as good as I remembered for Embassy Suites, but still good--better than Homewood Suites which also served a hot breakfast via buffet. Embassy had pancakes, french toast, sausage, bacon, cooked to order omlets, potatoes, toast, bagels, biscuits and gravy, muffins, pastries, fresh fruit, cold --cereal, soda, juices, coffee, milks, hot cereal--I think I've got most everything listed. Long line for the omlets, but it went fairly smooth considering they were cooking them to order. Actually this was the best part of the stay. Plus, I am a breakfast person. The teens preferred the breakfast here better than at Homewood Suites. We spent the 2nd day at Bayside Marketplace and came back mid-afternoon due to an afternoon shower. The hotel was freezing even though it was afternoon in Miami! This is when the girls called for the extra blanket. We did the cocktails again--the line was shorter--we were earlier, and it was Monday, so a lot of folks must have checked out earlier. Tuesday morning and our last day, a great breakfast again.... And time to check out. We took pictures in the atrium with Koi fish and parrots and headed out to Dolphin Mall to kill time prior to a six o'clock flight back to Kansas City via Atlanta. Express checkout was very smooth. We had prepaid for both days on line, so the only charges was $30 for 2 days parking which I left on the card. We dropped the hotel room keys in the dropbox at the front desk and departed the hotel. Overall a good stay. Only issues were being kicked out of the computer room, no trash can in the bathroom, lines for services in the atrium, inconvenient bathroom set-up, and the hotel temperature. If breakfast is important to you, and you don't mind paying for parking, this hotel will do fine. It is clean, functional, and secure. The breakfast and cocktail reception are the highlights of the stay. These are the freebies that come with the price of the room. I recommend prepaying online if you can for convenience once you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, convenient airport location, slow airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: APSWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night prior to a cruise leaving Miami. We had to call the hotel and wait over one hour before the hotel shuttle arrived. When we complained to the manager on duty we were told that management knows there is a problem but has opted to keep staff costs down and have only person available to drive the shuttle; I was told to please complain. The suite was very nice as was the large complimentary breakfast. The property's restaurant was only OK and somewhat expensive; I would suggest you go elsewhere for a meal outside of breakfast. Lovely atrium and outdoor pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fall1004
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying in this hotel after a last minute cancellation flight to New Jersey due to a snowstorm. It was my husband and I and my two young children ages 6 and 3. We all enjoyed the stay at this hotel. Great service, spacious rooms and good housekeeping. Guests receive complimentary breakfast from 6:30 - 9:30 and free bar drinks from 5:30-7:30 along with freshly made popcorn. I would definelty stay here again if I return to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and really Convenient”
Reviews.Author: pafuri
Reviews.Content: We stayed here en-route to New York just after Xmas 2008. To take you through our experience: Check-in: It was very busy, being an airport hotel, and though the staff were hectic, they were friendly and efficient. But it took a good 15 minutes to get our rooms. Next morning we took the shuttle to the airport and it was great- there were too many for the one bus, so the hotel brought out an additional minivan so everyone could get to the airport on time. Rooms at the hotel are great- spacious, updated, 2 TVs, mini kitchen, and all situated round a central well. In the evening there was a manager's reception where free drinks and bar snacks were served for an hour or two. Boy, is it popular! We ate dinner at a steak- house on the premises, which was so-so. But all in all for an airport hotel it was really a cut above others I've stayed at. Price? We got a special at round $120 including breakfast- which made it a real bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Embassy Suites Miami”
Reviews.Author: travelnut2007
Reviews.Content: I'll start off by saying that I really enjoyed this hotel. I have stayed in Miami hotels before a cruise 8 times in the last four years. This hotel has been the best by far. We arrived at the hotel around 6pm. Check-in was quick and accurate. The front desk associate informed us that the Manager's Reception had started and that we had an hour and a half to enjoy the reception. We went to our room after check-in. The room was very spacious, and clean. I particularly liked the fact that the sleeping area and living area were separated by a door, creating two separate rooms. The room was also equipped with a microwave, which was good for my sister because she needed to heat something up. After unloading our bags in the room, we went down to the Manager's Reception. The bar staff was very friendly. The drink list was more than I would have expected from a free cocktail party. It was a nice break after a long day of travel. The design of the hotel has an atrium-style, open-concept dining/social area that's the height of the hotel, with water elements and tropical plants. It's very inviting. The highlight of the stay was the breakfast. I was expecting a warm continental breakfast. However, what I got was a big buffet style breakfast with warm pancakes, fresh fruit, cereal, breakfast sides (sausage/bacon/homestyle potatoes), biscuits and gravy, juices, milk, coffee...etc., etc., etc. all served in the open atrium area. The perfect start to our morning, and COMPLIMENTARY! At check-out, there were no surprise charges. Parking is only $11, and includes in/out privileges, which is more than reasonable for the area. There's also a free shuttle from/to the airport; however, we did not need to use it as we had a rental car. Overall, a great start to our vacation. I will definitely be staying here again in November for my next cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent but overall a solid choice”
Reviews.Author: Safadinho
Reviews.Content: I fly through Miami on a regular basis and this is my hotel of choice. It has these upsides: an excellent gym, an ample free breakfast, high speed Internet, an excellent location near the airport and lots of cable channels. The negatives would be slow elevators (shades de Havana) and very little nearby (shoppings, restaurants and bars). If you are flying in late, take the hotel shuttle van from the airport and pick up your rental car the next day from Enterprise (located right across the street).

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms ! Great Staff ! Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: love7761
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and I had the pleasure of staying at the Embassy Suites. The staff was the best that I have come across in many years. They were courteous and always ready to assist. Hats off to Aldy and Nicole. Embassy Suites should be proud to have staff as great as these young ladies. They really should be in management or training other staff on how to treat guest at the hotel. I will alway try to stay at this property when I am in Miami as long as they keep this wonderful staff. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: bluedesert
Reviews.Content: As with most Embassy Suites, this hotel provided us with a convenient, comfortable overnight family trip to Miami. As you can tell from the pictures, they take the tropical theme to heart in their decor and the rooms are freshly remodeled with comfortable beds and LCD TV's. The staff seemed accomodating and very responsive, the building was remarkably quiet despite being at the end of the runway, and the complimentary breakfast wasn't gourmet, but it was quite satisifying. There are a few items to consider with this hotel: ~Unless you are quickly transferring between the airport and/or a cruise, it's best that you have a car at your disposal (parking is $10 per night). ~However the property is right in the middle of a swirl of intersections and highway interchanges, so be prepared to do some alert navigating. ~The neighborhood doesn't abound with top-notch restaurants...I recommend jumping in the car for a bite at Bayside Marketplace downtown (good variety, a vibrant crowd, beautiful views, and even a nifty food court!). ~Plus downtown and South Beach are a straight shot, 10-15 minutes away. Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for pre cruise”
Reviews.Author: willmann
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights pre cruise in November and found this hotel a solid choice for the money. The positives: Very large, nice but not great rooms. They include comfortable beds, large living room which has space for a table for 4, and three sinks total. Room was quiet except for some planes taking off (we faced the airport. The staff worked hard including fast check-in (still busy at 1 AM), and helpful in setting up port transportation for 23 at $10pp. The pool area was nice, although the pool was cold, and the workout room was first class. The grounds and lobby are in nice condition. The breakfast was good although large lines formed later in the morning. This is a large hotel which I suspect is very busy every weekend so expect large numbers at breakfast. The staff worked hard and seating was adequate. The negatives: The hotel is located in a no manâ€™s land. The only possible place to walk to is a Bennigans, which I would not recommend going to after dark. We ate at the restaurant for lunch and the food and service was good, although we were the only customers. At dinner, the staff and cooks were terribly understaffed. It took forever to get our food and it came out randomly. This is with only half the tables filled, and people were waiting to get in. I would just order room service, which should take about 45 min to an hour. Towards the end of the free drink time, the line was huge with 25-30 people waiting. The two bar tenders were working hard but could not keep up with the demand. Overall a good hotel, just donâ€™t get to dinner or the bar line late.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for an airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tbrielmann
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you are just passing through or have a car available, though parking is pricey for an airport location at ten bucks a day. What makes this property most enjoyable is the typical Embassy Suites very large room and the good breakfast. (There are free drinks at happy hour but we were always somewhere else at the time.) We had a very comfortable king bed. Easily the best value at MIA airport. You are NOT close to downtown, the grove or Miami Beach. The restaurant on premises is lackluster. During our stay the hot water completely failed, one elevator was out of service, our room keys were mis-keyed, the thermostat and tv remotes had dead batteries. It is rare for so many issues to occur at once but I will say that our complaints brought instant results. (Yes, we had "warm" miami showers that one morning but after we calmly expressed our disappointment we were given a generous discount for our troubles.) Positives: Eager to please attitude prevailed. Cheerful and efficient front staff. Large, comfortable rooms. Recently updated guest rooms. Very convenient to airport. Nice pool area. Convenient to EZ (on premises) and Enterprise car rental (walk across.) A very enjoyable full breakfast is included which is a good money saver. Negatives: Older property with some issues. No restaurants within walking distance. Pay for parking and internet. Poor sattelite TV reception. Van service spotty.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Hilton instead”
Reviews.Author: wesandkim
Reviews.Content: Worst experience with this hotel. We used to stay at Embassy suites anytime we travel which would have been 5 different ones in 2 months, but this hotel changed our minds and our future reservations. Shuttle was great. We checked in and things were great, front desk staff recommended a few places to eat etc..... We decided to eat at the restaurant at the hotel (steak house)... big mistake. Food was great.... waiter was a total waste to include serving flat beer, having to ask for drinks to be refilled, asking for silverware, waiting forever for the food to clearly be able to tell it was cooked and ready and the waiter took too long to serve it. Waiter ruined dinner. We shook it off and went back to our room, watch a little TV, go to take a shower.....No HOT water and water was sitting in the tub? Can't be.... called front desk..Sending someone right up.....30 min later husband went down to front desk... moved rooms....still no hot water .....Now 10pm....changed rooms again.....no hot water, now 10:45pm. Was then told it was a boiler problem and should be fixed by morning, but we could talk to a manager... now what is he/she going to do about not having hot water boil me some and bring it to the room in sauce pans? We had to be at the airport by 5:30am could not wait until morning on a hot water and a prayer. Called guest services.... refused to give us the number to another hotel and did not have a phone book in room. I called the 800 number for embassy suites and they gave me the number to the Hilton. Then the Embassy charged us for each local call we made to try and find another room. Finally, husband was at his breaking point and calmly asked the front staff to get us a room at the Hilton and take us to that hotel. They agreed and had the shuttle take us to the other hotel. An unbelievable experience to say the least. The experience was so bad when we got home we cancelled our future stays at Embassy and booked with other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Aviod if you can”
Reviews.Author: JFTraveller
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Embassy Suites in Washington DC a few days earlier we were looking forward to our 2 nights in Embassy Suites Miami Airport, having booked an executive room with a Family Package of extras. We did not book the infestation of ants however, and the hotel staff were not helpful at resolving this just handing us keys to the adjoining room, which when we checked was also full of ants. Whilst waiting for a new room a maintanence man turned up and gave a half-hearted spray around with some chemicals without moving any of the tea/coffee making equiptment or cups out of the way first. All 3 rooms we were in had not had the linen changed on the pull out bed. Restaurant poor for both food and service. A big let down all round,

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: bigdog12771
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre-cruise. We picked this hotel because they offered shuttles from airport to the cruise port. At the airport we only waited about 10 minutes for shuttle bus to come. The front desk staff was very nice. We ate dinner inside the hotel, it was a good meal, the staff was abit slow for only having two tables to serve. Our room was very clean and accommodating for 4 people. We had a balcony with a sliding glass door. We did attend the Managers Reception which was mixed drinks and popcorn. In the morning we had a cook to order breakfast, which is another reason we picked this hotel, it was very busy. We then got on a shuttle bus that took us right to the cruise port. For the price we paid for the room, mixed drinks, breakfast & shuttle buses, I think it was well worth the money compared to other hotels. I have nothing to complain about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Circus”
Reviews.Author: estinem
Reviews.Content: 2nd time to miami and decided to stay at the embassy, the hotel is stuck in the 80's era but the service from front desk is great and atentive. as for maid service it took 30 minutes for soap. i ate there 2 meals that were good but service stanck as the manager was talking about sexual objects with the waitress. check out was fast and smooth. won't come back again

Reviews.Title: “View from a wheelchair”
Reviews.Author: parfro
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for an overnight stay because it was such a short distance from the terminal. I could not get into its shuttle, so we found a wheelchair cab and the hotel paid for it as well as for the one gong back the next morning. We were very surprised! The accessible bedroom was on the 7th floor and we were pleased to see how much space there was. In the bedroom was a basin - set much lower than the one in the bathroom, but I could not go near either of them because they had doors set flush underneath! How stupid is that? Otherwise, the bathroom was most acceptable and the suite was very comfortable. Breakfast in the atrium was a bit too crowded for my liking and if you are catching a plane the cooked-to-order food will certainly delay you. We stayed with cereal etc.

Reviews.Title: “Florida atmosphere but service could be better”
Reviews.Author: RILtraveler
Reviews.Content: The shuttle to the hotel was free and convenient. We rented through EZ car rental which is located in the hotel lobby. Our room was clean and large but nothing special. The bed was firm but adequate. One elevator was not working and getting to our floor was a pain. It is under contruction so try to book a room on a lower floor that you can walk to. There is no free internet. You have to pay or use the business center which was full of kids instant messaging, doing myspace, etc. The management makes no effort to limit time on the computers - I guess they want you to get frustrated and pay for internet. Customer service is poor, the staff really didn't seem to care. But the price is ok, we paid $140 per night, and if you want to be close to the airport it is fine. You will need a car to get around. It is tricky getting into the hotel entrance by car, in fact driving around in that area is tricky. Our garmin was even confused. We were going on a cruise and the cost of the shuttle to the port is $10 per person. The free buffet breakfast was good, better than most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Stress, Stress and more Stress”
Reviews.Author: Adrian Loveridge
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking of booking a hotel near the airport pre or post flight with the least stress factor, then do not book here. We actually stayed five nights and prepaid. First, without doubt, it is the longest I have ever waited for a courtesy bus from the airport to the hotel. One solitary front desk clerk was trying to book in several guests, so another prolonged wait. Of the five elevators (there appeared to be no service elevators, so maids and porters had to use the only ones accessible to guests), four were working. So to get to the seventh floor (where our room was) it often took 10 to 15 minutes. Multiply this at least five times a day and you can sense the annoyance. This was further aggravated when issued key cards mysteriously and frequently did not work which required another extended wait to get them re-issued. The lure of a 'cooked to order breakfast' had its booking attraction, but the reality is quite different. Every day we had to line-up behind 20 to 30 people and then scrable to try and find a clean unoccupied table. It did not seem to make a difference whether it was 7am or 9am. The noise generated from literally scores of seemingly un-supervised children in the breakfast room and lobby drowned out any jumbo jet taking off over the hotel. On our first night we tried the solitary restaurant (The Barcelona). After first being told we would have to wait as they were busy. We were seated some minutes later, only to count 13 diners and at least 6 serving staff. We gave up on room service one night as we could not get an answer from either the front desk or room service numbers. Two other nights room service worked well but be prepared to pay $2.50 delivery charge plus 20% service and then a tip on top. On our last day we had arranged for a late check-out only to have the room maids bang on our door at least 10 times. And finanally, after settling our extras bill, at 1.50pm we waited for a 2pm airport courtesy bus. When it hadn't arrived by 2.10pm, I questioned reception as to when we could expect it and the concierge stated with had missed the 2pm, despite being there the entire time. In hindsight, we had a choice of two hotels, Embassy Suites or the Sofitel. Next time, I will waive the 'free cooked to order breakfast' and book somewhere I can hear myself think and access my room in a reasonable time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: Zakima
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel as pre-cruise. After checking with all the travel sites, booking with the hotel site was a little cheaper. *Check In Though the front desk clerk was not the friendliest person, I guess it was acceptable since I enconutered a lot of bad customer service in Miami before. The only problem was the room keys kept demagnitized and stopped working. I don't think that's the hotel's fault. You just have to keep your room keys away from cell phone and other electronical equipment. *Room The first room we were in had bad smell and it was unbearable according to my husband, so we switched the room. The second room was very clean and no problem. *Public Area Beautiful garden, pool, and work out area. Be careful for bugs around the pool area!! *Manager Reception They provide nightly reception with FREE drinks! Yes, you can go back and get as many drinks. (Make sure to tip though) There are chips and nachos for children, and it's family friendly. We enjoyed it very much. Over all, the stay was very comfortable. If you have family of four or more, it's cheaper to book this suite than to book 2 rooms from other economy hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hilton Standards”
Reviews.Author: cj3kids
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites Miami Airport is the worst hotel that I have experienced in the Hilton chain. Dead fish odor in the laundry room trash can. Fire alrm went off 10 times during the evening and night, TV and microwave did not work, did not have wash cloths and front desk sent up tan handtowels (rags) used by housekeeping to clean with to be used as washcloths. Rooms were filthy and food and cosmetic remains of previous quests were evident everywhere. Complaints went unanswered.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience overall except for the location”
Reviews.Author: GD77
Reviews.Content: Great experience overall. The only real negative is the location. There's not much out there within walking distance or is the neighborhood really conducive to walking. You really need a car to go anywhere. Staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. The breakfasts and mangers receptions are great and way above your standard complimentary breakfast deals. A minor negative was the room was a little dirty - neat and tidy but the cleanliness could be improved, e.g. felt like there was sand on the sheets underneath the cover and there were pubic hairs in the bathroom and bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Masterkodie
Reviews.Content: Beautiful old building. Indoor garden very nice. Rooms very out dated. "Full" size bed was at best oversized twin. Airconditioner very loud and draining from ceiling into "kitchen" area sink. Micro-wave disfunctional and everything very cramped. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: beachlover325
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites in Miami for one night on May 19th after our wedding in Punta Cana and before heading to our honeymoon at Sandals in the Bahamas. The first Embassy Suites shuttle (they are complimentary to and from the airport) that arrived was totally full and then the second one went flying by and didn't even stop. I called the hotel and they said they'd reimburse us for a cab since it had been close to an hour by then. It was only about 6 minutes to get to the hotel and cost a flat fee of $10, plus I tipped $3. I got the total $13 back when we checked in. The hotel is an open atrium type with all the rooms facing the center. Check-in was quick and she gave us complimentary bottles of water. Our room was 809 and really big with a separate living room with a big flat screen tv, separate table, couch and chair and ktichen area with sink, microwave and fridge. It was really nice and the king size bed was comfy. The shower backed up but for one night it wasn't a big deal. I worked out after we arrived - the gym is open 24 hours and was really nice - new machines and weights. The cardio machines all have their own tv's that you can hook your headphones up to. I also saw an outdoor swimming pool that looked inviting. We ordered room service from the steak restaurant in the hotel. Although expensive (it costs $74 (including the $2.50 charge and 20% surcharge) but was delicious â€“ my husband had the 12oz filet mignon with mashed potatoes and broccoli and I had the same but with chicken instead, plus it came with a tasty warm loaf of bread. Delicious!!! Our room included free breakfast but we had to leave at 6 AM for our flight so we missed it. We did pay for internet - we wanted to upload some of the many photos we took at our wedding - and paid $9.95. We checked out very early at 6 AM and waited about 10 minutes for the shuttle to the airport. We were there less than 24 hours but overall we were very happy with the hotel and definitely recommend it as a great airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: globetrotting2003
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a overnight prior to our trip and overnight at the end of our trip. Great airport hotel, we enjoyed the free breakfast and the free evening cocktail reception. We found the best rate by contacting the hotel directly. We chose this hotel because it offers hotel pickup and drop off 24 hours, going every 20 mins, and also offers a shuttle service the Dolphin Mall. Just outside the property and walking distance of about 5 mins is Bennigans, which we ate at, the food was great and service and price was good. It was good value for money and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great building, pity about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Waltersabroad
Reviews.Content: Fantastic looking building even though it's close enough to the airport to see (and hear) the planes take off and land. Despite the beautiful courtyard with palms, waterfalls and even some caged birds and the restaurant, which was not half bad, the rooms and other services in the area were lacking. Problems in room included a faulty toilet that sounded like the wall was going to come down each time you flushed; an airconditioner that leaked water (and it puddled) on the carpet in front of the fridge. When the AC was turned on it sounded like a V8 engine coming through the room. Also, had to call twice for toilet paper to be delivered to the room. The microwave did not work and of the two TVs in the room, one did not work (had a line running across the screen) and the other's remote was broken. Also, after sitting in the lounge area of the room for an hour, bug bites appeard on our legs - not sure what they were, but it was disgusting. As for services, do not use the gift shop or room service. Two diet cokes (10 oz bottels) cost us $9.00 - room service, while the gift shop was overpriced beyond belief. I always stay at an Embassy Suites, but will never stay at this one again. Two nights was bad enough.

Reviews.Title: “problems in paradise”
Reviews.Author: love2travel016
Reviews.Content: I was travelling on a family gathering in Miami, and my family booked at this hotel previously. I arrived at 2230 on a Thursday and Friday morning enjoyed the breakfast they offered, subsequently we left the hotel around 1430 on Friday and returned at 1600, on return luggage from our room had been stolen. My major concern was the way in which the hotel handled this, the first question they asked was "should we call the police?" I also noted that on return at least 3 room doors were opened by housekeeping and the rooms unprotected by employees, thus violating their own policy - to get into this hotel you have to go through a gate into a secured compound. My warning is this: the hotel accomodations are nice and pleasant, be very careful about your possessions and use the safe!

Reviews.Title: “Not alot for the money!!!”
Reviews.Author: WorldlyTraveler81
Reviews.Content: The hotel was neat and clean. We were able to check in 3 hours early which was great, because we had an engagement to be at during check in. The staff was extremely friendly and nice. The Manager's cocktail hour was great, and the breakfast was fantastic. The restaurant, while I didn not eat there, advertised Omaha Steak products of which I am not a fan of. The hotel is a little hard to maneuver into the first time, but you can get the hang of it after a few in and out trips, and it was nice to know my car was parked in a secured lot with 24/7 security. Overall it was great, it is just so expensive to stay there, I paid $160 and didn't feel like it was a great deal. But if you compare with other hotels in the area, it is the most affordable hotel without complaints of mouse droppings, so we were willing to pay the price. Wish I could have gotten more bang for my buck, Miami is just an expensive place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: jbird1277
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here to attend a conference at the University of Miami. Having flown into the Fort Lauderdale airport, the hotel is hard to find if you are not familiar with driving in Miami. Be prepared to make a few laps around the airport before you find the entrance to the Embassy Suites. If you fly into MIA it would be very convenient, as it is right next to the airport. Look for the big pink hotel... it is hard to miss! We had a king room with a sofa bed in separete living room area, typical Embassy Suites room. The entrance to the bathroom was in the bedroom, which I didn't like, though. There was an opening sliding glass door off the bedroom that had a tiny balcony. Enough room to stand, not to sit. Although it was right next to the airport, the glass is pretty soundproofed. The balcony looked over into the pool area and the airport. The pool and hottub area was nice and made to look tropical. Although they should do a better job of keeping towels stocked. There was a long line for breakfast, which can be frustrating. The Happy Hour evening drinks was a nice feature that we enjoyed, though. The internet service in the room worked fine, although I will be glad when Embassy Suites stops charging for this service. Room service is also available. It was a short (but harrowing) drive to many spots in Miami, including South Beach, University of Miami, Little Havana, and Biscayne Beach to name a few. Overall, I would stay here again if in the Miami area. It is a good central location and much cheaper than the hotels on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suites hotel with great breakfast. OK Area.”
Reviews.Author: lovebirdsonthego
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice on the inside with lots of very lush and tropical landscaping throughout the lobby. The breakfast in the morning was great, as it is with most Embassy Suites. The room was clean and spacious. The hotel itself was close to the airport and served its purpose. There was not a lot else to do in the area and the area is not very picturesue. You will not get a very "Miami" feel while staying here. Everything else was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Too Short a Stay for Too Nice a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scubatripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night in the Miami Airport Embassy Suites, and it was a more than perfect evening before our morning flight. Like most Embassy Suites built from the ground up, this one had ten stories of rooms, all opening out into an Atrium with trees, fountains tables and wireless access. Rooms are more than comfortable and they had the best flat panel TVs I've seen in a hotel yet. One in the master bedroom and one in the living room. They also have the best free breakfast of any hotel with an omelette station, tons of fruit and breads, pretty much the works. The onsite restaurant, Barcelona, has great steaks, reasonably priced. The desk staff was extremely helpful and friendly and even offered to pick me up at my car rental facility, so I could drop my car off and not have to deal with it before my early morning flight. Even though we had a panoramic view of Miami International Airport, we didn't hear a sound in the room. Embassy Suites aren't cheap, but they are worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Excellent Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: CtRooks
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to Miami for fun in the sun, and wanted an inexpensive room, so I tried Priceline.com. They placed me at the Embassy Suites Miami Airport. When i arrived the front desk was very friendly and completly explained the workings of the hotel, When I got to my room it was very clean, but I did smell a strange odor, I think someone smoked in he room though it was non smoking. I opened the balcony door and the room aired out nicely so no complaints. I decided totry the Manager Reception, they offered great free drinks and chips and salsa. I was pleased with the quality of the drinks, mosy hotels water down even when you pay for them, but they did not. The next morning I went to breakfast. It was an awesome spread to be complimentary. I even commented to the manager how i enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: rjsailnsd
Reviews.Content: Big room, very friendly staff. We arrived at MIA at 12:50am Christmas morning. The Embassey Suites picked us up with a smile. Very good included breakfast, nice room, paper every morning. Easy to drive to many great Miami destinations from here. Got the rental car pakage with the room which saved us big $$$. EZ-rent co in the lobby. Gated parking $10 a day. Nice stay overall. Had a very good dinner at Bennigans next door.

Reviews.Title: “Below par”
Reviews.Author: CDY
Reviews.Content: Needs renovation, more attentive upkeep. Older property, good location, next to MIA which leads to some noise issues. Burn holes on couch, dented beat up door, room service dishes sitting outside rooms for hours. Windows need cleaning ect.. Needs better management, not enough help at front desk. If you have to be next to the airport, ok choice at best ,otherwise stay somewhere else in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Looking Better”
Reviews.Author: itsaboutthepeople
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night for a business trip. Arrived in time for a late dinner and departed early in the a.m. The room I stayed in had already been re-done. It was clean and nicely appointed. I didn't notice any noise. Dinner in the restaurant wasn't horribly impressive, but it wasn't crowded. The wait staff was attentive and well-meaning, though we had more communication issues than I would have expected in the U.S. Otherwise the hotel is a pretty typical Embassy Suites. Because of the way it's laid out, the front drive seemed to always be crowded and had a bit of a zoo-like atmosphere. I plan to stay there again. It's much better than some of the "nicer" hotels I've stayed in in the area near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “We'd definitely stay again......”
Reviews.Author: sccheeto
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room here in spite of all this hotel's criticism for one night before our December 2nd cruise. We were surprised and delighted to find the remodel complete, the rooms in very good and new order & the staff to be pleasant. The food in the restaurant was good but cold. We had to reheat it in our microwave in our room. Our only other criticism is that it took us one hour and 20 minutes to get their shuttle from the airport to the hotel. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Miami HANDSDOWN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cubanito1
Reviews.Content: OK this Hotel is the best value in Miami period. Lets hits the cons first. CONS: 1. Located next to the airport, so noise may be a problem. 2. Construction around the streets leading the the Hotel. 3. Views of Miami once you get past the views of the gravel pits and parking lots. 4. 10 bucks a night parking (but you have in and out privis) PRO's: 1. HUGE ROOMS (Ill post pics later ) 1 bedrooms suites over looking a beautiful atrium. 2. Breakfast, forget the cold coffee and stale Danish, they have a HUGE breakfast buffet every morning with made to order omelet's and about every thing you could want. It rivals the best Sunday brunch youve ever been to, and this was on Monday morning! 3. Free nightly reception (I skipped it but heard it was great) 4. Atrium that has fish ponds, sorry I dont know the tech term for it. 5. Very comfy beds! 6. Central to everything and lost proof..think about this for a second. You're in Miami partying or at a function..then when its time to leave, if you don't know where you're going you could get ripped off by a cabbie, or lost in your rental car..but this Hotel is located at the airport, so just follow the signs from anywhere with a plane on it..simple really. 7. SAFE SAFE SAFE!!! 8. THIS IS THE BIG ONE V A L U E !!! It cost me $139.99 a night for a huge room and all the surprise amenities it comes with which you'll discover for yourself. Try finding this in Miami anywhere! I tried and couldn't! I just want to shout out, the great customer service I experienced there during my stay. Cristian Ramirez and Roosevelt Raymond both security people were great, they made sure my room was ready early, got me a cart to haul in some gifts from a party I went to, and even left me some freebies in the room for me and my fiance. Please ask for them if you need anything, they are the reason I will always go back there from now on. Them and the price, who am I kidding. Embassy Suites seriously worth a look!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!!!”
Reviews.Author: Irelandred
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews we were "scared " to stay at the Embassy Suites Hotel. We were pleasantly surprised! This hotel is above average. The rooms were very nice and clean. (we had our room move 3 times due to no air in the room) The lobby was massive and very very nice. This is a very large hotel. The front desk, hotel staff and everyone there was very helful. (Not at all rude as in the other reviews) The breakfast was wonderful but should stay open until at least 10:00. Location okay. If this resort was located on the beach it would be a 5 star resort!!! The only negative thing about this hotel is the elevators - they are way too slow. There is really no stair access - you have to walk around the hotel to find them. On both sides of the hotel one elevator was down - it doesn't sound like much but a hotel this size it makes things extra slow!! Overall if you have to stay at the airport I would recommend this hotel. The shuttle was great and we really had no problem like the "other reveiws". The manager or assistant manager (his desk is located across from the front desk) on duty was very helpful to us and you can see him walking around the hotel all day long. He asked us several times if everything was okay, etc... At breakfast I even saw him picking up breakfast dishes!!! He might be the reason this hotel is turning around the bad reviews???? Good job!

Reviews.Title: “mold and mildew made this stay unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: frog19
Reviews.Content: Our stay made us physically sick. My husband and I stayed one nite at this hotel upon our completion of a cruise in October 2007. The hotel looked okay on our initial entry, however, our first room had such a strong odor of mold and mildew, we requested a room change. Our second room was a little better, but still had the mold smell which seemed to worsen when the air was running. The windows were stained and need to be replaced. When we complained about the overwhelming smell of mold, the front desk clerk admitted the hotel has some problems with the smell in some rooms. It is apparent the property has had some renovations. The Elevators are scary- they are slow, old and small. After reading some of the comments on this website, I concluded i needed to share my experience. I actually developed a respiratory infection within days of my stay and had to obtain medical treatment. The good news about the Hilton Hotels/Embassy Suites policy is that they provide 100% satisfaction or you get your money back. When I complained to Hilton customer service, they refunded my costs. I will never stay at this hotel again, but I will stay at other Embassy Suite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A big plus”
Reviews.Author: julietravelut
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel pre-cruise and it is a wonderful location to stay at. Close to the airport to drop off rental car (would suggest dollar or thrifty for cruise as they have free shuttle to the port of miami). Great happy hour with friendly bartenders and not skimpy on drinks. Really good breakfast as always. Quiet, clean rooms. Pricey as all hotels are in Miami area but kept looking on website and price continually fluctuated till I found price I liked. When you consider the drinks and breakfast, really not a bad deal. All staff was very friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a short stopover”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneAnglo
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites are a fine way to stay with young children - its the cheapest way to get a 2-room suite in the US. Our kids (2 year old twins) loved running round the balconies, the lifts, the fish ponds and the evening cocktail and popcorn sessions. Also the breakfasts are plentiful and varied, I love staying at Embassy Suites and would again without hesitation. Note that this hotel is in the same road as many of the car rental locations.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: kingofthejungle22
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice place to stay. I was on my way to South America to visit family and I had been told by some friends to stay here as they had done. I must say, it was really convenient to the airport, just a short 5 minute drive on the hotel shuttle. When I got the the suite, I noticed that it had just been renovated. They had all new furniture, new beds and the room had a beautiful wet bar area with granite top and also the bathroom was very clean. In the morning my whole family (5 of us) enjoyed the breakfast which was very plentiful, with eggs and pancakes for the kids. The staff was pretty friendly too, one of the breakfast helpers noticed that our son said it was his birthday and they made him a special pancake with Happy Birthday written on it and a candle. This is good hotel for anyone stopping in Miami for 1 night or even for longer. I hope we get a chance to go back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - no complaints”
Reviews.Author: NEFrequentTraveler
Reviews.Content: I think this was a great hotel and would recommend it highly. I cannot understand why the negative reviews. I would rate is a four star hotel versus three. Our family of four stayed here the night before our cruise. The room was clean and newly decorated with good quality decor. The two rooms were sizeable, the beds were comfortable and clean. We were allowed to check in at 12:30 at no additional cost. We used the pool and the dining room and found the both satisfactory. The dining room was a little slow, but the food was tasty. The center atrium was very enjoyable including the full sized trees, waterfalls and fish The manager's reception was nice, but the liquor was not top shelf. The hotel served popcorn and corn chips. The breakfast was excellent with just about anything you could want for a hot breakfast. The price included hotel shuttle from the airport (30 minute wait) and bus to the port of Miami. ($179)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Bryan_m36
Reviews.Content: Having stayed often at this property I again stayed here last weekend. I must admit that all my stays at the embassy suites in Miami were excellent. Ok, the rooms aren't renovated but the beds are new and they are very comfortable (I slept very good). My room did not have new furniture. They are currently renovating the rooms and I stayed on the 8th floor and I saw them working on both the 9th and 10th floor so I think they are going from top to bottom. The breakfast was good. The staff nice. So overall I am happy with the service and quality for what I have paid for. Usd120

Reviews.Title: “worst experience ever in a Embassy suites”
Reviews.Author: jamineNorcrossGa
