Reviews.Content: Worst experience ever in an Embassy suites, we travel alot and have stayed in 5 diferent Embassy suites but nothing compared to this... rooms did not have water, then there was water but no hot water.. then we were in the 2nd floor with a balcony door that did not close ...call front desk, he was so rude..sent a security guard that just put a chair in the door...next day we went to the front desk they changed our rooms but lost our lugage....and the same rude guy said that there was nothing that he could do that we had to wait until next day 7am we were sweaty and tired and he totally didnt care, then we found our bags went to our new room wich the door to the balcony did not lock either...to make a long story short from 5 rooms they gave us 4 had their balcony doors broken and I kept telling them this is a safety hazard and the guy just said if something happend I dont care because the wont sue me they will sue the hotel....That night we finish going to bed at 4am in the first room that they had given us in the 6 th floor that the door did not work either but to us it felt a littlebet safer way up there....the bathrooms had stains in there tubs and grime in their tiles...it was the worst. Then the next day we spoke to the manager on duty and the same nothing was done.....it was horrible... If I was the owner of the embassy suites I would not permit this hotel to have that name because it killed the perspective that we had of the em bassy suites.... and there was alot of unhappy people in that front desk..something is going on bad in there and I hope that is not to late, that someone does not get hurt because of their negligence with those doors.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mactoki
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business several times because it is cheaper than the other Hilton brand hotels in the area. The hotel itself is dreadful. The room decor is extremely tacky as is the lobby, atrium and all other hotel areas. They claim to be doing a renovation but pictures I saw of the planned changes did not seem that great. The rooms have a microwave and a fridge but no cutlery, plates or glasses to actually eat from. I had to go all the way down to the restaurant to pick these supplies up. They would not give a plate so I had to steal one from breakfast! There are 2 sinks in the bedrooms and bathroom, neither of which worked. The plugs were broken on both meaning I could not shave. The girl at reception seemed totally uninterested when I told her this. The shower did not work correctly - half the water came out from the bath taps. The bedding was basic and the pillows very old and uncomfortable. The room smelt funny. The TV was ancient. Often the elevators did not work correctly. Another problem I had was one morning I needed to pick up a package from them that had been delivered to me. Reception said that I had to go to the security office to pick it up. However the security office is always closed! It took days to get my package. However the worst is yet to come! One night I arrived very late (about 1:00am in the morning). The guy at reception told me that they could not accommodate me and had given up my room. The excuse he gave me was that they had had some storm damage two nights previously. He said he had arranged accommodation for me at the Sheraton which was about 30 minutes drive away. So I drove to the Sheraton, tried to check in and was told that they also had run out of rooms! I was outraged. I then got sent to the Airport hotel which was another 30 minutes away and very inconvenient. I didn't get to sleep until about 3:00am in the morning after a long flight. I think this is unacceptable especially as I am a Hilton Diamond member. I also happen to know that there were no storms two nights before in Miami! The one redeeming feature about this hotel is the breakfast which is pretty good. Also the hotel is cheap if you pay in full up front, but this is not enough reason to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel from [--] a complete dump. think twice before you stay here”
Reviews.Author: Tennie007
Reviews.Content: First I must express my disappointment with my Travel Agent for recommending me to this place...I stayed at The Embassey Suites from May 18th to May 20th 2007 and from the moment I check in me first impression of the place was that it was worn and in need of a face lift. Upon checkin I was greeted by a very unfriendly agent who appeared to be very tired and just wanted for this to be her last duty for the day. She asked to see my credit card which was on file, I told her that I wished not for my credit card to be charged and opted to pay cash in full with an additional security deposit she told me that it was not neccessary given that me credit card would not be charge and I can settle at the end of the two day stay. Little and behold on the second night I was complete humilated and embrassed given that Security had locked me out of my room. I went to the Front Desk spoke with a so call Manager named "Karyn" who appeared to be clueless as to what had occurred and expressed to interest in my concern. I again asked her what was the problem given that I was locked out she indicated that they were charging me credit card two hundred dollars a day security..I immediate informed her told her of what her agent said to me upon checkin and paid my bill in full. I told her that I would like to have her General Manager "Juan Carlos Palacious returned a call to me to express my total disatifaction and she said that he cannot be reach she had no contact information at her property for him. I became furious I demanded that he return a call and went to my room escorted by security to open my room door. Karyn left work at 11:36pm on May 19th 2007 and never returned a follow up call. No word from Mr. Palicious as well. Upon entering my room I freaked to find out that not only was the door locked but the room was not clean at 12 midnight. I went back to the Front desk and spoke with Marcos who confirmed that Karyn left and he was the only person on property that I can speak with and we was only an agent..You can imagine what was going through my mind during this time, I ask Marcos to contact his Manager or some senior person and he told me that no one was reachable. I asked Marcos if this was indeed an emergency with a Guest at his hotel what is the process he told be that he would call the revelant athorities and write a report and update his GM when he sees him. I could not believe what I was hearing and became fearful knowing that his hotel did not have a senior person availble to assist guest conerns. I noted the many definciencies with room 7-314 room very moldly, room leaking near the sliding door I jumped out of bed into a pool of water, faucet is leaking in the bathroom, shower is broken, no day service, TV had a black screen unable to view. tile cracked in the bathroom, the furnitures are worn and old, and the staff need a completed training course in customer service and how to handle complains they were completely unresonsive and refuse to take responsiblity for their own ineptidue. This place is a complete waste of money particually when you are paying almost $200.00 a night not worth it at all...The first room that I was assigned was 7-432 which was completely unbearable from the moment you entered the room mold everywhere..I opted to eat breakfast outside of the hotel given that I was concern about the cleaniness of this Hotel. Please note that I tried calling your 800 number to get some help and spoke with Erin in resevation who said that there was nothing she can do and question me as to why Marcos told be to call the 800 number. I asked her for her last name and she said no. I was so furious at this hotel and in total disbelief that there was no Customer Service of any kind anywhere at the Embassy Suites (MIA). I told Marcos that iI wanted a Manager to call me at first light in the morning to speak with them prior to departure and again up to 11am on May 20th 2007 no response from no one...unbeliveable. I then motion to the Front desk and spoke with the Security Manager who said that he was the Manager on duty and I told him my concerns...and asked to speak with the GM he told me that he was not available. I reinterate my conerns and asked him what the [--] is going on in this place with only one Security Officer on duty at the front gate and no other management presence anywhere..he said that he was the way they do things there..I pulled out my business card and told him that I was a Hotel Manager at a world class hotel and told him that if my guest needed assistance with a concern that warrants my attention my staff can reach me without a doubt. When he saw my card he started to act nice.. I also told him that if I needed to reach my chaiman I can reach him without a doubt. i told him that my number one Core value is to "Blow away the Customer" and my staff is impowered to make it happen. My Guest is of utmost importance to me and to have any of my Guest leave unhappy is a major problem. I told him, my staff are impowered to resolve issuses. I suggested that they train these people in customer handling to appreaciate the value of a guest particually when there are other options..I requested the GM information and was given one night credit which was totally unaccepatable and not the response I was looking for. So all of you who are looking for a Hotel close to the Airport think twice about this place and also the security of yourselves. Today I tried calling the GM and again no response....I can also suggest that you hire JDPowers and associates to check your standards if any. I will never take my travel agent advice again..

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect any type of service at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: red71MS
Reviews.Content: FRONT DESK STAFF IS HORRIBLE! I am not one to complain, but if I can help someone avoid this place I will. I am writing this in my hotel room so the experience will be fresh in my mind. My party checked in on Sunday May 6, four of us with seperate rooms. As we checked in, we told the front desk staff that our luggage had been delayed and would be delivered later. We also stressed to them that we wanted our luggage as soon as it arrived, even if it was in the middle of the night. I called at midnight, 3AM, and 5AM and each time I was told that the luggage had not arrived yet. In the meantime, I was on the phone with the airline and was told that the luggage had been delivered and was at the hotel. I went down to the front desk and was put off until the security guard came on duty at 8AM. At this time, the meeting I was in town for is about to start and I am standing in the lobby with wet hair and the same clothes I had on the day before. Anyway, he went down to the security office and said "Oh, look here it is". I grab my bag and as I pass the front desk she said "well I guess it was here the whole time". No appology, no nothing!! At least I was more fortunate than one man in my group, they couldn't locate his bag until noon. Also, the room itself is fine. Nothing fancy. When I initially checked in I was given a room that had not been cleaned since the last guest. I thought this might have been just a mistake but when I went down to the front desk to get a new room, the rest of my group was down because their rooms were dirty too. Again, no appology was given. As a paying customer I expect some courtesy and service and since I was given none I will warn others about my terrible experience. I will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: bighead33
Reviews.Content: I juust returned from my second stay at this hotel. It is a nice an conftable hotel for families, the two room layout is specialy good with families with small children, they sleep in the sofa bed while the parents sleep in the main room. The rooms are not so fancy and they would probasbly need a refurbhish but keep in mind that this is not a Four Seasons or a Mandarin Oriental, you get what you pay for. The chek in was fast, the room was clean every day on time and everyone treated us very good, this are the things that count for me. if i wanted a full facilities hotel i would stay in a complete resort, a hotel were you check in and stay in it for your complete stay, a embassy suites is not this kind of hotel, this is a place were you you to take a bath and sleep. Next time that i'am in miami with my children i would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Rude Horrible Treatment- AVOID!”
Reviews.Author: justdroppedinn
Reviews.Content: First off, I've NEVER posted a complaint about any business before. This was one of the worst experiences not just in my travels but in my life. Hotel would not honor a CONFIRMED, PREPAID RESERVATION (!!!) (perhaps they had overbooked?)- Desk Manager K---n T. was basically rude, said "take it up with Expedia" (even though they have a contractual relationship and Embassy Suites was, i was later informed, obligated to comply with the reservation). As if, at Midnight with two children in tow (!), i'm supposed to get a court order forcing them to give me the room for which I was showing documented proof or payment? Amazing attitude of non-responsibility for their own mistake and willingness to leave paying guests in a terrible situation. Told us "sorry, nothing we can (or will) do", wouldn't even make a phone call. sounds like I'm exaggerating this situation but i'm not at all. We had to sleep in the car in a rather sketchy area. So, unless you want to risk a dangerous, cold night without a place to stay, i wouldn't be looking at this place. An unbelievable experience, unbelievable treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else to stay.”
Reviews.Author: jtwisconsin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nightsâ€¦.two before our cruise and one afterwards. This was by far the worst Embassy Suites I have ever been at. First off when we arrived at the Miami airport around 10:30 we called for a shuttle. I could barely understand the person, but managed to finally figure out where I was supposed to go. We waited outside in the dark, all alone, for over 30 minutes. Tried to call the hotel back a few times but they wouldnâ€™t answer. Finally after about 45 minutes the shuttle arrived, and when I got to the front desk they didnâ€™t have a room for us. This after I had made a reservation in advance and specifically called the hotel directly to tell them we would be arriving late at night and I wanted to be sure I had a non-smoking room held for my family. All they had was smoking rooms or one with a conference table (for in-room interviews) where the living room would normally be. We choose the room with the conference table, so essentially we only had Â½ the room we were supposed to as the living room was unusable. This hotel has a nice pool and the staff seemed friendly, but it needs lots of help. The public areas inside the hotel are very dirty, the rooms have a terrible moldy/humid smell that is almost unbearable, and the place needs some serious repair and refurbishment. The sink in the bedroom sprang a leak in the middle of our last night and flooded the carpeting, and we got stuck in one of the elevators once. Plaster was falling off the walls in everywhere, and the kitchen/breakfast area was just gross. You can do better than this hotel. I certainly wonâ€™t be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel...Staff rude”
Reviews.Author: tpany
Reviews.Content: No ammenities, Staff was not helpful at all. Could bearly speak english. Acted like they did not understand anything we asked them. Do not stay here. Find different option.

Reviews.Title: “Great last minute stay!”
Reviews.Author: teresamzamudio
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the last minute thru Hotwire--we sooo lucked out! Our two children LOVED the hotel decor and the glass elevators. Pool was not heated though. Room was perfect for us, very clean. Fixtures were a little dated and had a light bulb that was out--but those were no big deal. Managers reception was good-had beers and bloody marys. Breakfast was very good and quick. Would highly recommend to traveling families.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, avoid !!!”
Reviews.Author: MajicBus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when arriving in Miami. I've stayed at Embassy Suites across the US and this is by far the worst one ever. The lobby area is nice, however, the room we had was very musty, noisy, curtains were torn. The bedding looked like it had NEVER been washed. I would never stay here again.
